Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location; Excellent Marriott EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: mrsgochay
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights last weekend. The room was spotless; the service was efficient and pleasant. We got exactly what we asked for--a nice quiet room on a high(er) floor. The requested room service arrived within moments of check-in. All the employees are smiling and chatty and just lovely. None of this is unusual for a Marriott. ALL Marriott Hotels are this good. What's nice about this one in particular is the location: right next to the Eaton Centre and WALKING distance to most if not all of downtown Toronto. The room was erormous. Could actually have fit a sofa or at least a love seat in there. I wasn't too thrilled about not having access to the window, but it was an oddly shaped room and perhaps the desk really couldn't go anywhere else. The only negative, if you can even count it as such, is that I loathed the "gold/yellow/baby-poo colour of the walls in the room--but that's just personal preference on my part and nothing really to complain about, We spent most of the time walking around TO anyway, or sleeping in the AWESOME bed. We didn't eat in the restaurant but had a really good cup of coffee one morning. I would be very surprised if the restaurant didn't live up to Marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “Always love staying at the Eaton Centre Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: WorkinTraveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday for a one night stay at 12:00 and was still checked into my rooms right then. I had booked two rooms and was very pleasantly surprised that they anticipated that I would like adjoining rooms even though I hadn't requested it. Also requested a high floor and was given the 16th floor! Nice to have a hotel listen and respond to requests. Check in was great, was engaged by the front desk agent the entire time, he made a point of making conversation with me while he did his work to get me checked in. Only thing that was missing and would have been nice is a quick run down on the hotel itself. But, checkin went very quickly and efficient. Arrived at the rooms and was very impressed as usual. Everything was spotlessly clean, I can usually find something to comment on when it comes to hotel rooms but the room was actually perfect. View was amazing and the bed was extremely comfortable. Did not hit the restaurants on this visit, but everything from top to bottom for this visit was first class! The staff here are so pleasant and engaging! The Eaton Centre Marriott certainly sets the bar for the Marriotts in Ontario! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stylz1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome for several reasons. Huge rooms, clean and renovated. Great lobby to hang out in. Amazing location and accessible to Eaton Centre. Great staff, this hotel knows what they are doing and when I stay in downtown Toronto they are always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jlabrie
Reviews.Content: I like Marriott, and the Eaton Centre is a nice property. Good staff, clean rooms, decent restaurant on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peersy12
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The staff is overly helpful, going out of their way to make the stay perfect. Rooms are nice, large and tvs a large size. Evryone here works to make your stay the best it can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: dereck_bown
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly staff, good food - pity the room wiater couldn't go further than the threshold !!!! Oh and if you are a husband leave your wallet at home as the hotel is connected to the Eaton Centre; shopping mecca for wives !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Marriott. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: scrutineer44
Reviews.Content: Yhis Marriott is located immediately next to the Trinity Church and the Waton Centre; immediately in the heart of downtown Toronto. Internet is for a fee of $16 per day for wired or wireless in room. Parking is a whopping $26 per night ($36 with valet service). Reception and checkin staff are flawless and will help you with anything youay need. The bar and main restaurant is on par with other Marriotts I've been to. The rooms are nice and spacious An feature all you'd expect from the brand. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, minus the noise”
Reviews.Author: SoxFan08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott this past weekend since my girlfriend was attending a conference there and we thought it would be most convenient if we stayed onsite at the hotel, and it was somewhere new for us to try in the heart of Toronto. The Marriott met our expectations with great customer service and very nice rooms. I utilized the gym which was fairly small with 5-6 treadmills, some weight machines, a few ellipticals and 1 bike. It was definitely good enough for me to get in my daily workout. I walked through the pool area which was separate from the gym, it also seemed pretty small but well maintained. Unexpectedly our stay was impacted by the noise level in our room. I am usually a very sound sleeper, and after the few drinks I enjoyed with dinner I was expecting to sleep the night away. We both had a restless night and were actually annoyed with the sounds of the hotel. I thought it sounded like a vacuum cleaner being turned on and off repeatedly, she said it sounded more like a hair dryer. It was emanating from the air vents and continued all night long. On top of that there seemed to be regular noise from the bathroom plumbing and a continuous tappin. In the middle of the night we both got up and put on our iPods so the music would drown out the noise and allow us to sleep. We are both very easy going and were surprised it affected our stay to the extent that it did, but we both agreed the next morning that we should have returned to the hotel we had stayed at a few months earlier in the same neighbourhood of Toronto with better value. Perhaps it was just our location in the hotel, but the noise definitely left a lasting and poor impression with us both. We keep asking ourselves, was it just us??? I hope you have better luck with a â€œquiet stayâ€� if you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen T
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in and check-out. Quiet, clean, modern room. This hotel has a slow parking garage elevator and forces you to call housekeeping if you want your bedding changed. Marriott also has uncompetitive internet access rates - because internet and phone are bundled together as a package. Other than that, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but way to expensive”
Reviews.Author: TrueLeaffan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with average amenities. The prices are way to high for what you get... a room. If you are looking for central location, than this is a great place. It is right downtown and shares the bluck with the eaton Centre. If that doesn't appeal to you, I suggest you save your money and stay elsewhere or spend it and stay somewhere much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: woozietraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend in Toronto at the Marriot Hotel Eaton center. We had a very nice stay, an excellant clean room friendly staff and a great breakfast in the morning. We have been there several times before and will probably be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Saturday crowds, but very nice room”
Reviews.Author: kpetronio
Reviews.Content: The lobby was extremely crowded at just about any hour. No free wi-fi in the rooms was a negative. Towels were scratchy. The room was very clean and in a quiet setting. They gave us a corner room at check in that was very nice as well. Hotel bar was pricey, but made excellent fresh drinks. We did not eat at the breakfast buffet, but it looked great! Juicer available to make your own juices, lots of choices. Overall, it was nice, but we would probably stay at a different Marriott property unless we were determined to spend time in Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “2 uncharacteristic "blips" mar otherwise perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: HeyNow-Hank
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in the heart of downtown Toronto. It's located right beside the Eaton Centre mall (in fact it's directly connected from the inside). Nathan Phillips Square (along with it's outdoor ice skating rink) is just across the street. The subway and underground PATH system are also very close by. For music lovers, the hotel restaurant/bar looks out onto a courtyard through floor to ceiling windows where, just steps through the windows, sits The Church of the Holy Triniity, site of the Cowboy Junkies lo-tech masterpiece album, The Trinity Session. There were 4 or 5 doormen/bellmen located by the entrance and the front desk was also well staffed. All employees were extremely helpful and pleasant. The fitness centre and pool are located on the top floor (18th). The fitness centre also looks out over the city through floor to ceiling windows and is very well equipped with all the latest machines. There were no waits during my entire stay (and I exercise at "prime time" - at the end of the business day). In addition, all machines were equipped with personal TVs. There was also a basket full of new complimentary headphones that were yours to keep. The pool was very clean and well maintained but very small. There was no way you could swim laps in it. The hot tub was large and also very clean. It was also nicely separated from the pool by a translucent barrier. My room was a good size with a convenient corner for business and all the plug-ins you could possibly need to charge your electronic devices. The HD TV was an older model, judging from the picture quality. The housekeeping in my room and the rest of the hotel was impeccable, with ONE exception. Like most hotels these days, sheets are changed after a certain number of nights (or every night, upon request). This hotel said the sheets would be changed after the third night (and, of course, with every new guest). Well, when I turned back my sheets while going to bed on my fourth night, the same sheets were still there (I could tell by a slight smudge that was there at the beginning of my stay). This got me to thinking, if the hotel didn't live up to it's first promise (new sheets after the third night), did it live up to it's second promise? (new sheets for each new guest) Looking back at the smudge that was there when I arrived, I now can't be sure that I was sleeping on fresh sheets the first three nights. I however, have stayed at this hotel before and believe this was an uncharacteristic mistake. The sheets were changed the next day, after I left a note for the housekeeper. The second blip occured with the air conditioning. The first night, despite the fact it was below freezing outside, I could not get my room cool enough. I put the thermostat down as low as it would go (60 F or 16 C), however the room would not even get close to that temperature. The next morning I asked for it to be looked at. I was told a service person would check it and that the staff would leave a message on the room telephone to tell me what they'd done. When I got back to the room that evening, there was no message. However, the room did seem slightly cooler. That night, the room still didn't get even close to cool enough, despite the thermostat down as low as it could go. I gave up trying to get it fixed properly or change rooms, because the room was marginally comfortable at night, and I didn't want the hassle of changing rooms. I believe this was uncharacteristic as well, however, I was not pleased about not getting the promised phone message. Bottom line is my sleep experience was not nearly as good as it could have been. On the bright side, the bed was extremely comfortable, and there was no noise. Other than those two things, the hotel was perfect. Since I've had a good experience here on a previous stay, I will give this hotel another chance. If there are problems again, this property will have seen the last of my business.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Noel58
Reviews.Content: Described as a business hotel the Eaton Centre Marriott is also well suited for leisure breaks, situated close to a range of attractions the hotel provides an ideal base to explore Toronto. We had connecting rooms, these were prepared to a very high standard, house keeping do a first class job in this hotel. Rochelle on the Concierge desk provided sound advice on transport, tickets and even where to find Ontario's best apple fritters at the St Jacobs farmers market! Food was good and service from all of the staff was extremely professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean hotel. This is a typical Marriott. The room isn't cramped and comes with a coffee maker and some pretty decent coffee, the bed is comfy, the bathroom clean and spacious. There is a desk and seating area incorporated in the standard room. The gym has modern equipment. There is a nice bar area. This hotel is attached to the Eaton Centre and often has deals where you get a $25 shopping certificate per night (look for deals at the Marriott site). I was there for an extended business stay my first weekend came back to find a thank you note from the Manager and a fruit basket. Nice touch! My only complaint with Marriott's is that they tend to charge a good rate, but don't include internet. For a "business hotel" you would think that this is standard, but all the higher end hotels seem to charge for it. Why is that?

Reviews.Title: “A great overnight at a great hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wendooshka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre Hotel on Jan. 6th. We live in a suburb of Toronto and decided it would be fun to "go downtown" and have a mini-vacation. We were able to get the Romance Package which included 2 buffet (or a la carte) breakfasts, chocolate covered strawberries and sparkling wine. This package is well worth it. From the moment we valet parked ($32), to the time we checked out, the service was outstanding!!!!! Everyone was friendly and very professional. We had a corner unit room that was very nice. It was very comfortable and very clean!! The bed was super comfy. We overlooked City Hall and we were able to watch the ice skaters at night....very pretty view! The room had a safe, which, unfortunately we didn't find until the next day......it's in the drawer of the desk!!!!!!!! The hotel has a walkway to the Eaton Centre, so we were able to leave the winter coats behind to do some shopping and have dinner. The Trios Bar in the lobby is quite nice and overlooks Trinity Square which very pretty at night with all the lights on. After having a cocktail at the bar, after shopping, I asked for a hot tea to take back to the room......$4.50?????? For a tea bag and some hot water?.....this is the only complaint that I have about the hotel. The breakfast buffet is very good with all the foods that you would want, including an Omelette station. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Toronto as it is close to everything and if needed, you can take the subway to places you might not want to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel attached to shop/subway”
Reviews.Author: Mallowmow
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Location, Location, Location. It is attached to the Sears store in Eaton Centre which easily accesses the subway and streetcars. In the cold weather, you don't need to go outside to reach the subway which is really nice. They have the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen at a Marriott. It is much pricier than what you will find in the U.S. but if you like breakfast it may be worth it. They even have a juicer with prepared vegetables that you can juice, cold deli meats and cheeses, omelet station, typical hot foods section, compotes,oatmeals, breads, etc. There is also an indoor fireplace area where you can sit inside by the fire and eat and read if you like. All in all- really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: We live outside Toronto, and use this hotel for weekend getaways. Its in a perfect location attached to the Eaton Centre and subways to get around. Its a newer property, clean, and nice rooms. Get a room on the upper floors for better views, and less traffic noise. We always find the staff to be helpful and responsive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer relations”
Reviews.Author: AnnG_16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a large family group who travelled from Ireland to Toronto for a wedding, the management and staff were wonderful, this was not only about the facilities of the hotel but they were very helpful in guiding us where to go in Toronto and how to get there. Great location, very central.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Cassie1209
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, Excellent room service, great for business. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hallake2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my family of 4 and my mother last weekend and we were really pleased with the hotel. It is in a great location - attached to the Eaton Centre for some last minute Christmas shopping, and close to Nathan Phillips Square and other Toronto sights. The rooms were large and nicely appointed. The beds were comfortable. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it....”
Reviews.Author: Cremdella
Reviews.Content: Nice layout...very clean rooms, not a terrible price. What else can you ask for

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Niagarax
Reviews.Content: Everything one would expect in a Marriott. Excellent location for shopping at the Eaton Center. One does not have to go outdoors to get to the mall as there is a covered walkway connecting it to the hotel. Great convenience in the winter. The service at check-in and at the restaurant was great.Stayed with my wife and adult daughter. The room was quite spacious for the three of us. The shower worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed - terrible shower”
Reviews.Author: rosapisces
Reviews.Content: Really no complaints about anything except the shower - which matters. I was on the 10th floor, it took forever for the shower to get hot and when it did the temperature fluctuated radically from luke warm to scalding. It's amazing how not being able to have a normal shower can affect my overall impression but it does.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Heaven”
Reviews.Author: SylvieFrancois444
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for three nights for a conference. The room was typically Marriott - very nice, great view of the Church and gardens in between the Eaton Centre. The staff were wonderful! Bonus, no need to go out with a coat since the Marriott has indoor access to the Eaton Center...Shoppers Heaven for sure!!! Also had a problem with the shower - very hot...but not an issue. Had a Bloody Ceasar at the Hotel Bar...ouch..10$ for a small glass. Decided to go shopping instead...hihi!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: HGrant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for three nights for a Conference. The room was very nice, a good view and the bed was very, very comfortable. The Staff were great and very helpful. The shower however was very touchy and the water was either scalding hot or very cold. Other than that it was great and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great loctaion”
Reviews.Author: travelh027
Reviews.Content: My friends and I always stay here when going downtown. Its located near everything we could possibly want. The rooms are a nice size and clean. The staff are also great!

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of it all....”
Reviews.Author: goldseashell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and it was great. The location with indoor access to the Eaton Centre cannot be beat. The rooms are spacious, nicely appointed with a super, soft, comfy bed and crisp linens. Ask for a room rate which includes the breakfast buffet because it is worth it. The buffet has a station for made-to-order eggs, fresh juicing machine, breads, cheeses, and other hot and cold buffet items. There are more than enough choices to satisfy all dietary needs and desires. The hotel is close enough to walk to major attractions. The staff is attentive and helpful. This is a good hotel choice for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel (the last time was for a conference a few years ago). The location of this hotel is excellent â€“ very central and close to public transport, shopping, restaurants, etc. Of all of the Toronto Marriott properties, this is the most central. It think it may also be the most expensive of all of the Toronto Marriott hotels. The hotel was very busy during my stay with several conferences and events, but the staff maintained a good attitude. As an elite member, I had access to the ground floor concierge lounge and the complementary buffet breakfast each morning. The breakfast was top-notch including a wide variety of fresh produce. Concierge lounge nibbles in the evening were a little disappointing, but the staff were friendly (I think this area used to be the old steak house). Compared to my last stay, my room was a little disappointing. It really needed a bit of a â€œrefreshâ€�. Even the bed was not quite as comfortable (it sagged a little in the middle), as a normal Marriott bed. I did spot a few dust bunnies. And I agree with previous posters, they need new cable service for the TV. The lobby refurb looked great -- now they just need to tackle some of the older rooms. If the price was right, I would go back. I wish you could give Â½ star ratings on Tripadvisor as I felt this was 3 Â½ stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: SKKF
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at this hotel as the location is great. In the winter you are close to the skating rink, you have the covered walkway to the Eaton Centre and there are great breakfast choices nearby. Skip the hotel's restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. It's not excellent, but it is a very good Marriott. The check in staff were nice for the most part. The restaurant is not very good, so I would not eat in the restaurant unless you have to. The location is in downtown, so it's in the heart of things, but you have a fair number of homeless people and transients around. It's a little scary to walk around late night by yourself, but othewise, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Downtown Eaton Toronto a very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Expert_King
Reviews.Content: (1) Location of the hotel is ideal , my wife was thrilled as it was within short walling distance to the Eaton center one of the largest shopping centers in Toronto (2) Room is spacious compared to other 4 star hotels, good furniture, clean and neat (3) Good entertainment with LCD 37 inch TV with on demand movies and more (4) Staff are friendly and professional, good staffing numbers very adequate (5) Breakfast was great and included in the price of around US$ 200 per night , very fair price for this hotel, the breakfast included fresh fruits (Produce of Canada) and eggs and an egg station and many other delights

Reviews.Title: “Great experience during conference!”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Addicts
Reviews.Content: I recently attended an annual work conference from the 17th thru 19th and I have to say that I was very pleased with the hotel. From the concierge and front desk staff, everyone was very nice and attentive during our stay. The hotel was clean and modern and the King room was spacious, with the most comfortable bed (slept better than at home). During the conference, the food/service department did a fantastic job with meals. We never went hungry and the quality of the food was excellent. The ballrooms and meeting rooms were well kept and allowed for great meetings by day and fun parties in the evening. I did not have an opportunity to use the recreation facilities but the location of the hotel is ideal. You have easy access to everything you might want: Yonge Street, Eaton Centre, China Town, Financial District, Entertainment District etc. Parking at the hotel's underground lot was easy and efficient... No worries if you're planning a stay at this downtown Toronto hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Toronto city center”
Reviews.Author: kawhalen
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location, which is excellent, as you can walk everywhere from there. It's also right next door to Eaton Center shopping area, where you can catch the subway and all the tour busses. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a connecting dbl / dbl (5 of us). While the beds were comfy and we had plenty of room, the guest rooms are in need of a renovation. Had all standard amenities including coffee maker and fridge and robes . The rooms were clean, but when you looked closely, you would feel it needed a deep clean.. Ie around baseboards, walls and ceiling in bath, etc. service was excellent at front desk and concierge! Only had a drink in the bar, which was average hotel lobby bar. Didn't eat there. My biggest negative would be the super thin, over starched towels.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: OB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Eaton Centre for a conference. Location is good and the hotel is quiet. I was disappointed with the Internet service, though: $15 + $3 service charge daily, from noon to noon, with some interruptions. At over $250 a night, that's not too good.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch property in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: VACanuck
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property, having stayed at many of the other Marriott properties in the city, including the Renaissance and the Bloor Street property. I must say that this property is run like a 4-star Marriott SHOULD be run! The bellmen were professionally dressed and attentive. Front desk staff were also equally attentive (unlike many experiences I've had at the Renaissance where staff are talking to each other or even on their cell phones, texting!). The room was very well appointed, clean and spacious. Our only flaw to note is the cable tv. There was a problem with their wiring, etc. We were moved to another room, and the same problem existed there. We were told by a maintenance man that the problem exist(s) throughout the property. We rarely rent movies in hotels due to the expense, but decided it would be nice to watch a movie in the room. We could not enjoy it at all due to the 'snow' and distortion on the screen. That should really be addressed by the property. Otherwise, all was good. We slept well and would highly recommend this as a top-notch property in the Toronto shopping district. If you found this review helpful, please click on the link below! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for wandering about downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: trip-together
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel Sept 29-Oct 2nd. We are a couple in our late 40's. I usually pick hotels that are at least 3.5 stars, preferring 4 (or more), if the price and location are right for city stays. In this case, price was a bit high, but location was key. I would rate the hotel an easy 4 stars I am rating excellent however, as the service was just perfect. From the front desk, restaurant, door-man .....everyone seemed to be trying very hard to be smiley and attentive. I have Marriott points, and wanted to earn more, so I choose a Marriott for that reason. I also like the consistency of Marriott Hotels. WE had a King reserved and it was received at the CAA rate of 179.00 per eve, on their website. Actually, it was cheaper to reserve on the website as opposed to Hotel.ca and Expedia....so check the property websites! The front desk person, at the members desk was a natural! He was extremely helpful, genuine, and professional. A younger man who just seemed to have a knack for helping. This is so appreciated, as I repeat over and over, the front desk is the first experience of any stay, and is more important than some companies understand. This company gets it!!! The room was a corner room on the 8th floor. Very spacious, for city standards, but dark, because it did not have as many windows as some other rooms-being the corner room. Flat-screen TV, coffee maker and all of the wonderful bath products you would expect. The pillows were dreamy, as were the sheets, so much so, that I am thinking of ordering some for Christmas presents off of Marriotts website...down pillows. I am also rating excellent, as this property was spotless. The entry to the hotel, the restaurant, and more importantly, the rooms...spotless. The bathroom was smaller, but so clean, the size became less important. We had cocktails in the restaurant. Service was wonderful. Lounge/restaurant was "hotelish" but very pretty. The doorman was quick and smiley and had a great sense of humour ....each time we needed him. We ordered rooms service for breakfast our last day. The breakfast was plentiful, and eggs were done just right. All condiments we asked for were brought, and right on time as well. Pricey ($45,00) but delicious. The pedway to the Eaton Centre was my fav extra here. It did rain when we were in Toronto, so shopping...which was a goal of mine during this stay, was made easy with this entry into the Eaton Centre. You enter into Sears. Easy to find again as well, to re-enter Hotel. We will definitely return here, looking for weekend specials...as I would like to see a price drop for longer stays (more than 2 eves)...at the 160 mark.... as similar hotels in the area....upon checking, were lower. WE would also like to see free internet. The price of the stay should easily include this. Just a note ,,,the Marriott website is one of the easiest to navigate compared to other hotel companies. You get a reminder of your stay two days prior...wonderful. You can also ask for an email of the the invoice etc. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Just right for overnight”
Reviews.Author: MTBOttawa
Reviews.Content: Hotel has comfortable atmosphere and lounge on main floor is relaxing. Check-in was a breeze. Room was perfect. Nice courtyard right outside hotel as you head to Eaton Centre. Checking out next morning was simple. Only hangup was the boarding pass console was not working for Porter. But hotel staff did their best to help.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has potential but is dated”
Reviews.Author: PWRAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Good location and friendly staff I was given an upgrade to the Exec Floor which is in need of a makeover. The benefit of the Exec Floor in most Marriotts is access to the Exec Lounge on the Exec Floor. This is not the set up here, the Lounge is on the Ground Floor in a windowless annex off the main dining area. Upside is that the hotel is right next door to a big mall Downside is nonmatter how high you gonyou cannot get a decentbview of what is supposed to beba great cityscape, shame.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Joobert
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in September 2011 during the TIFF weekend. The hotel lobby was very spacious, and well furnished with comfy seating for tired travellers to wait while checking-in. In addition to being spacious, the lobby was decorated in a modern fashion with booth-like check-in desk, complete with a very professional and courteous staff who checked us in promptly. The room was clean, spacious and even included a pull out couch! The bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. My only complaint would be that the room could be more sound proof. We definitely could hear some...*ahem* rhythmic knocking on the walls from next door. Aside from that, the room was great. As most people have already noted, the location is fantastic! For those looking for shopping, the Eaton Centre is literally next door. Everything needed is within walking distance, but public transportation is just as accessible. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love the view”
Reviews.Author: Ewa213
Reviews.Content: Stayed September long weekend. Beds are to die for, so comfortable. Gym is amazing, if you are so inclined, and so is the view...from 18th floor. Had some idiot pull fire alarm at 4 am on Sunday, but was resolved within 30 minutes and not having to evacuate. Then hard to get out as Mcguinty crew in town and elevators shut down once again. I am voting NDP, horrible end for Layton. Expensive to park, $25 per day and daily rates are high. No other perks. Sign up for points card. Wanted to have a nice weekend before school, very expensive, again do not know how people manage in Toronto, perhaps they do not given the numerous homeless my daughter (age 6) began to identify.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Mauisw
Reviews.Content: Clean, good and kind service. No free internet, no breakfast included

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKitchener
Reviews.Content: Excellent location almost two blocks from the out of town bus terminal. Walking distance to most sites. It is across the streets from both old and new City Hall. The Eaton Centre is just steps away. Itâ€™s probably a 20-minute walk (rough guess and depends how fast you walk) to the Harbour Front with loads of restaurants (I ate at the Watermark Irish Pub). Lots to do here as well, check the information center. Great place to hang out on a hot afternoon, which is what I did. CN Tower is not far from here. Nice view from my room on the 15th floor. I had a huge bed, flat screen TV, comfortable chairs, coffee maker (and real cream is provided!). It was neat and clean. I just spent the night there so didnâ€™t scout for a lot of dining area. They do have a restaurant inside but of course is pricey like most hotels. Two or three blocks if you turn to your right leaving the hotel, youâ€™ll find Duke of Somerset pub. I sat outside on a beautiful warm evening. A short walk, I found a small grocery store in the underground. I bought croissants, a pastry and some fruit. The next morning I had the croissant and pastry for breakfast making my own coffee in the room. The staff are good.

Reviews.Title: “Location good and bad”
Reviews.Author: zofimama
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but small- could say the same about the pool! Circuitous route to get to Eaton Centre inside- easier to go outside, although this was iffy at night, when lots of people gathering in dark corners between hotel and Eaton Centre. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: krm500
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and found the hotel to be generally very good. The location, right next to the Eaton Centre, is ideal and makes it easy to take in all of the traditional tourist sights and access the subway. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the beds were comfortable. My only quibbles were with the bathroom. The toilet did not flush properly and the shower seemed to have only 2 temperatures: scalding hot or freezing cold. I didn't bother complaining since we were only there for 2 nights. They also really need more than 1 elevator to the parking garage. The wait for an elevator to the parking garage was quite long. Getting to our room was fine as there are many elevators that access the guest room floors. I got a discounted rate because I am a Marriott rewards member which made it worth it. Overall a very good hotel to use as a base for exploring Toronto but not quite up to the Marriott standards I have come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: fhovi9
Reviews.Content: I spent the better part of a week at this property. The room was comfortable and well-equipped...except for a small fridge that I was unable to obtain during my stay. The highlight for me was th staff. From the front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant/bar service, everyone was polite and very helpful. It turned out to be a very good choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on two seperate occasions within a two week period. Paid $200 a night the first time, and then $260 the second. I did get the internet and breakfast as part of the deal the 2nd time around, but would rather have paid the $200 without the extras, but didn't have a choice. The hotel if ideally located right in the middle of the city. Plenty of options for dinner around Dundas square. Beds are very comfortable and staff are numerous and helpful. The gym is huge and well equiped. The rooms are medium size, has a desk and a small lounge and coffee table. You are paying a premium price for being in the centre of the city and staying in a well maintained hotel, but I thought it was worth it. I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryAP2011
Reviews.Content: What a great location for a visit to Toronto! The hotel was very clean, the hotel staff were very friendly and information, and it was close to public transportation, which we used for our entire time in Toronto. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor customer service tactics.”
Reviews.Author: vaso815
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, there was nobody available to get our bags. But the parking attendants were telling us we couldn't leave our car there. We told them we were checking in. Finally, while checking in, my wife had all of the information that was given us when we made the reservation. We were to get a "cars eat free" weekend, as well as free parking. The receptionist informed us that this Marriott was not a participating member of the "promotion", even though we showed the printout of what was sent to us. After checking with the manager, they gave us one night of free parking, so we chose valet. We then called the Marriott rewards program, and they said they would give us 1,000 points for our hassle. The next day, we were talking to the concierge about places to see and where to get tickets for different attractions. He said, "I can get you all of your attractions", and quoted us prices that were much higher than what we were told they would be. We declined, and he became very indignant. As it turned out, his costs were much higher than what we paid. At checkout, we didn't have to pay for parking, as the same receptionist checked us out. She told us that they were called by Marriott to remove the parking fees. It was a nice hotel, but I would recommend staying closer to the center of activities. Don't eat at the hotel. There are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near mall”
Reviews.Author: cleste01
Reviews.Content: This is a renovated Marriott with an above average lobby and room. It is adjacent to a large indoor shopping mall in Toronto, which would have been convenient in the winter. The subway is about a block away in the basement of the mall. Restaurant options nearby seem to be largely chains and interesting parts of Toronto are a long walk away. However, we found this hotel to be pleasant and clean. The bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would return. Best beds in the city!”
Reviews.Author: hrmelness
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend is partial to the Marriott chain, so when we booked to stay here we came with high expectations. We werenâ€™t disappointed. The king bed was super comfortable â€“ you literally just sink right in, it feels so delicious just lying down. I can see why they advertise and sell their own bedding. The room we had was a decent size and had a nice view. The location canâ€™t be beat, youâ€™re right in the heart of the city, right next to the Eaton Centre and steps away from the hive of Dundas Square. The valets recommended cheap indoor parking in the office building next door. We usually check out the amenities of every hotel we stay at but on this stay we had a long full day and just had time to settle in for a good nightâ€™s rest. We had no issue with noise, and we slept really well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: San_Fior
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott Eaton for 02 nights and the hotel was up to our expection. We had the concierge lounge promotion and we enjoyed the free drinks and appetizers. No free internet in the rooms just in the Concierge Lounge. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds ( 04 people ) and it was not so comfortable as we are used to sleep in a King Size bed back home. The breakfast was awesome !

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: MaryinRoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July. Hotel was extremely clean. Bathroom was spotless and seemed very new. Had drinks and apps in restaurant/lounge...nice atmosphere overlooking courtyard. Convenient to transportation. Parking expensive but what isn't in Toronto? Easy walking to Canon Theater and to many restaurants. Excellent steakhouse two blocks away...easy to walk to...called Barberians...very expensive! There is a walk through to Eaton's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. AVOID restaurant for dinner”
Reviews.Author: KathleenKateW
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay except for the night we made the mistake of having dinner in the main restaurant. We are NOT demanding restaurant a patrons, but both the food and the service was poor. Service was very slow, even though the restaurant was not full. When my husband's Cesar salad was served with chicken instead of salmon, he had to hunt down the waiter to point out the problem, and the waiter barely seemed to care. Food presentation was fancy, but the food didn't taste very good. I had some fried rice that was much too gingery; my side dish of broccoli was overcooked; the key lime pie tasted as if it came from a mix - you get the idea. And for this we paid fancy hotel restaurant prices - ugh! Rest of the hotel - room, location, front desk staff, etc. just terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, courteous staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandMom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. It was everything we expected - it was clean and the cleaning staff were very friendly and attentive, the beds were soft and comfy with lots of pillows, it was quiet, and it was close to everything we wanted to do in downtown Toronto. You can't beat its location. Customers should be aware that free wifi does not apply to inside the rooms - juist in the lobby - it's an extra cost for wifi in your room but it is available for $15.95 a day and is high speed. We were there for the Caribana Festival weekend and the hotel took extra precautions to ensure the safety of their guests. Reception staff were super friendly and a great help telling us how to get around. We were 100% pleased with our stay and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeToo
Reviews.Content: Came for a short visit to celebrate our 5th anniversary. The positive experience began with a young lady named Lesley who checked us in, and was welcoming and gracious, and remembered to congratulate us on our special day. Our room was wonderful; clean, comfortable bed, spacious room with a nice view.This property has an amazing staff; all eager to make sure you enjoy your visit. You can't beat the location of this hotel; right at Eaton Centre, and short walk to many good pubs and restaurants, and local transportation for all the wonderful parts of Toronto, and there are many! Go to the Court House plaza if you are there on a Wednesday for "Fresh Wednesdays"; a local farmers market with fruits, flowers and baked goods...it's a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We will definitely be back to this Marriott. Not only for the location, but for the ambience, caring and friendly staff, and relaxing accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: finite35
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on two occasions, first in June 2007 and then again in 2010. The hotel is very clean, the rooms were a good price for the quality received, and, best of all, the location can't be beat. The hotel is located diagonally across from Nathan Phillips Square. It is also less than a block from the Eaton Centre Mall (shopping, quick bite to eat). Near the mall entrance you will find a Starbucks and the entrance to the subway where you can catch a quick ride to Union Station (CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc.) and/or other destinations in and around Toronto. I'd highly recommend this hotel for people who plan to tour Toronto and are looking for a decent value. Found the cheapest price directly on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, stunning decor, great service”
Reviews.Author: NandySelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights as a family, couldn't be more central for all the downtown attractions, everything's within walking distance and the hotel is connected by a walkway to the Eaton Centre. The staff were brilliant with our little boy and the bar/bistro was lovely. The pool on the top floor was perfect for a wee splash around and the room was clean, tidy and a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimvic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a business trip. We arrived particularly late due to a flight delay so were checked in quickly which was appreciated. The rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable, unfortunately there was no bottled water in the room which was disappointing given the hotel standard but this is my only downside of the stay. There is however a coffee/tea making machine and the bathroom is ample sized. I wanted to order roomservice breakfast but had missed the midnight deadline for putting the order on my doorhandle however a quick call to reception and I was assured that this could still be managed. Breakfast arrived right on time and was delicious (scrambled egs, well done bacon, juice and tea...perfect!). Check out was again quick and our bags were stored by a lovely, friendly concierge. Upon returning to the hotel we were helped with our bags into a car that the hotel ordered for us and on our way. All in all a great (if very quick) stay in a hotel with a great location. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marigold79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on two occasions with family and friends and really enjoyed both visits!! The rooms are clean and the beds are extremely comfortable...it was actually hard to get up in the morning! The hotel has a nice restaurant (not very cheap) and is attached to the Eaton Center by an indoor walkway. Made Christmas shopping an absolute treat!! All in all a great hotel - not a cheap stay but worth it in my opinion. Clean, comfortable, new...will definitely stay again if the price is right!! Front desk staff were not the friendliest...common to big cities perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “Central and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LifePortfolio
Reviews.Content: The airport express connect took me directly from YYZ to the hotel. Very convenient location. It is near Dundas square and attached to the Eaton Centre. Easily able to walk to all tourist locations within 15 minutes. Also easy to get to subway through Eaton Centre. The staff was very helpful with all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “excellent establishment”
Reviews.Author: kimmilil
Reviews.Content: staff exceptionally helpful and couteous, room well appointed , clean. very pleased . I travel for pleasure regularily and this is one of my favourites.Eaton centre right next door vey convenient location to the centre of everything ENJOY !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jamblix
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, typical Marriott, with an excellent location. It is near Yonge street, Eaton centre, Hudson Bay department store, Chinatown, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. They are all 10-15 minute walk. I had a pretty big room and bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & handy location”
Reviews.Author: Uncle Jack
Reviews.Content: I do not often give hotels 5 stars, but In this cars, it was not the physical structure, that is so good, but he hotel staff that shines. The Hotel itself is fine and we had no complaints about anything. The staff took care of all ours needs and requests with enthusiasm and the concierge even went so far as recommend vineyards to visit for our side trip to Niagra wine country. They arranged rental car service for us as well as airport transport.. All very reasonably priced and on time. he only down side to the hotel is that the restaurant seems to be somewhat expensive. The food quality in the restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting more...”
Reviews.Author: jaygordo
Reviews.Content: ...for more than $300 a night. I requested a King size bed but was surprised at how small the room was. One small window that didn't open. No mini-bar. And what is it with hotels charging more than $300 a night and still nickle and diming you with a daily internet charge? I can get free internet at the airport, train station, most every coffee shop in town, but at a +$300 a night hotel I have to pay extra for it? Really? The bathroom was small and not as contemporary as I was expecting. The only positive thing I have to say would be that the exercise room was pretty good. 18th floor with big windows and a nice view. It's also connected directly to the Eaton Centre for easy access to the mall...it that's your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel in Toronto, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Karslima
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a recent business trip. The location was convenient and also close to some really good restaurants. The staff was friendly and check-in and check-out was efficient. The rooms (or at least the one that I was in) was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable enough. The downside is that for $300 a night I was expecting free internet/wi-fi access in my room which they charged for (although there is free wi-fi access in the lobby area). I never understood why hotels that catered mostly to business travelers would not provide complimentary wi-fi service. I've been to small B&Bs in out of the way places who offer it free to guests. For that lack of internet connection, (and because I was traveling on business and really needed a hotel that had easy access) I wouldn't give this Marriott a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: BMAT_9
Reviews.Content: Old 4 stars. Old furnitures. Very clean hotel. Best location in downtown toronto. Bed not really comfortable. Good service

Reviews.Title: “Terrible elevators! Slow and packed full!!! Had to take the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Flinns_Luv2trvL
Reviews.Content: We checked out early (9am) on a Sunday morning. You would think the 4 elevators would be empty at that hour. They were slow to arrive at the lobby on Saturday afternoon, evening and the next morning. We stayed on the 5th floor of the18 floor hotel and never had a chance to get on an elevator. Six times the doors opened and closed packed to the gills. Finally, we dragged our bags down the 4 flights of stairs. The rest of the hotel was nice but a little dated. Tiled bathtub was clean as was the rest of the room. Some of the rooms can be far from the elevators. But for the deal that we received $149CN for a Saturday stay, we can't really complain. The beds were nice and we had a view of the church next door. Meal at the hotel restaurant was not bad, apple crumble with ice cream and creme brulee was pretty tasty. But there are so many hotel options for Toronto that we'll probably given another one a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: Check-in/check-out: Went smoothly without issues. We were awarded the same rate as our online reservations (with promo code). Our room was spacious, with a couch, a desk, two alarm clocks, a flat screen TV, a closet, coffee machine, ice bucket, full bathroom and nice big windows. We also paid for parking and were able to park until 6pm on our check-out day. This is a nice addition that was greatly appreciated. We asked for a late-check-out (3pm instead of 12pm) and were told it to they would give it to us for free. Location: Great location, right downtown near every shops, restaurants, landmarks and public transportation. The Subway and Eaton Centre are accessible via tunnels so you donâ€™t even need to go outside. Room Service: We ordered room service for breakfast one morning (You need to put your card with your order out at the door before 12am). It was delivered exactly at the time we asked for on a nice table with wheels. The food was good and filling. The server said to call him once we were done with our meal, but since this was our last morning in our hotel, we decided not to call and figured theyâ€™d pick up the table once we had checked-out. A few hours later, we were chocked when the server was back, knocked on the door and let himself in our room while we were inside. We were not fully clothed and told him to go away but he still got in the room and took our table away (with our fruits, and muffins still on it). We shall learn from this and put the â€œchainâ€� on the door when we are in a hotel room from now on. Other: * Free wireless is only available in the lobby. You must pay to have internet access in your room. This is not uncommon but I always find it a tad annoying. * The GYM, pool and jacuzzi are located on the top floor of the hotel and have nice views of the cities. The gym is clean, bright and spacious with lots of nice machines. The pool and Jacuzzi are average size and always kept clean. * The hotel staff was always very friendly to us and very helpful. They were always able to show us directions or suggest a nice restaurant. * We never heard neighbours or noises from the hall. Very peaceful stay. * We had a king-sized bed that was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Conclusion: I would recommend this hotel. The location is great and the hotel is up to Marriottâ€™s usual standards.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: Livedoc
Reviews.Content: For $269 I would expect a reasonably updated room like everywhere else I stay when on business. My "upgrade" when I arrived was larger room with a dining room but a bed that folded down from a wall. It was uncomfortable so I asked for another room. They said they were all sold out but had one room left with some damage on the wall. I took that because it had a proper bed with a backrest. There were stains on the blanket, floor and furniture and the room in general was from the 1980's...with a flat panel tv. It may be in a great location but I would expect a lot more from a Marriot, having stayed in other Marriot locations. For the business traveller this is a fleabag.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: hapkido
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel. We enjoyed our stay both times. The staff is nice and helpful. The fitness center is very nice and very clean. The best thing about this hotel is its location next to Eaton Centre. We had two days of cold rain but from Eaton Centre you can follow the PATH all over downtown and not go out side. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “nice solid hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: akiro_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the weekend (April 15-17, 2011). I was concerned about a recent report of bedbugs at this hotel on another website, and so I was prepared to cancel our reservation. When I called to cancel, rather than just accept my cancellation request and take the money (I prepaid a nonrefunable sum for the room), they directed me to a manager person, who immediately heard my concerns and showed me objective evidence of what measures were taken to ensure that no bedbugs were in this hotel. I was very impressed with this, and so we stayed, and so far, no problems. Very decent hotel, with super location and pleasant staff. We've stayed here several times, and everytime the staff have been exceptionally warm and given us some special treatment. A previous time, we had booked thru travelocity or some website, but accidentally booked two rooms instead of one, because of apparent excess clicking. They quickly cancelled the 2nd reservation once they realised the situation, no questions asked. This was not my experience at other hotels, and I have since stopped using these websites, preferring to talk directly with the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal”
Reviews.Author: akiyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Marriott Eaton Centre, which I really enjoyed. The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Toronto. The major tourist attractions are within walking distance (such as the CN Tower and the Rogers Center), not to mention its close proximity to the financial district of the city. The hotel offers you the advantage of being connected through a tunnel to the Eaton Centre, a very pleasant shopping mall. Although I did not order anything up to the room, I went down to the restaurant for breakfast twice. It might have been one of the best ones I had so far with its wide selection of pretty much anything you would want for breakfast. The room was clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable. There was a safe large enough to fit my laptop in, something I always struggle with at other hotels. Al the staff were very nice and helpful. I asked for a late check out which was granted to me free of charge. Overall, I think this is a good choice if you're staying in Toronto for a few days and want to hang around the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TLZZ
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I decided to spend one night at the Marriott Downtown as a pre-10 yr wedding anniversary. The hotel sure didn't dissapoint! Book-in online was quick and easy, check-in was a breeze and they even gave us a free upgrade to a bedroom suite to celebrate the occassion. What made it even more special was that they sent up to the room chocolate dipped strawberries and drinks along with a anniversary card signed by each member of thier team. Although the one bedroom suite was on the 5th floor by the elevators, the room was perfect. for us We had a living area and a very comfy king bed and amazingly comfy pillows. Although we didn't use the gym or pool located on the 18th floor we went up to visit. Wonderful views and the gym was very well equpped with the latest machines and free weights. The lobby was modern with a beautiful fireplace and a good breafast/coffee/drinks bar too. The location was perfect! We were right downtown with a 2 minute walk to Eaton Centre and Yonge and Dundas square (Toronto's version of time square). Addtionally, there were pleny of wonderful restaurants, places to shop, the subway transit system, buses and taxes within a 1-5 mile radius of the hotel making it very convenient for just about everything! This is a must stay hotel for anyone wanting to truly explore the Toronto downtown core with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience, falls well below usual Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: The_Budges
Reviews.Content: If your intent is to visit Toronto for a few days, and would love to be situated within a few steps of the quintessential downtown core, this hotel may be suitable, however, as a frequent business traveler, I would have to say this particular Marriott hotel fell flat for us. Service was rather cold, not a very inviting atmosphere when first entering the lobby. No smiles, or genuine welcome, information about the hotels services, just straight down to business. Although the reservation clerks were quick and efficient, when I inquired about booking an additional room for a family member who had decided to join us, I was told they couldnâ€™t make reservations at the front desk, we had to contact the Marriott Reservation office, I have to admit I did find that a little off-putting.. We had booked two (2) double rooms, and will say that I was a little surprised at how small and dated the rooms were, definitely a no frills, basic room, and the â€œblow dryer in the bagâ€�, was just way too cheesy. Sorry, but a flat screen TV doesnâ€™t bring a dated room up to todayâ€™s hotel standards. Also, no WIFI in the roomsâ€¦ However, I was happy to see the luxurious bedding system that I have to come to expect from the Marriot (down comforters, custom duvets). The hotel is situated in an amazing spot, a quick pop out the side door, across a small courtyard (Trinity Square) and you have entered into the lobby of the Toronto Eaton Centre, absolutely perfect for shoppers, also, as we were in Toronto visiting a family member who was staying in St Michaels Hospital, I was happy to report it was a mere 4 minute walk from our hotel to the hospital. Perfect location. As for the hotel itselfâ€¦ Only one (1) restaurant, which we did not take the opportunity to try, the awful smells (think Burger King) wafting through the front lobby, turned our stomachs away from even trying, also, I wanted to mention the Room Service prices were absolutely ridicules, so there was no way, we would have considered trying that either. Pool and fitness center are on top (18th) floor and make for a great view, however, again, we didnâ€™t have a chance to participate in either, however, I my daughter did report that the pool was very small, but the elliptical equipment was in good repair. High Speed internet is available for a charge of $15.00 CDN per day, however, the guest rooms are wired only, apparently the lobby and public areas are wireless. On site parking costs $25.00 CDN per day, or $30 CDN for Valet, which for the extra $5.00 we thought the Valet was worth it. Again, due to the location, I would recommend this hotel to those who want to spend a few days shopping or visiting the downtown core of Toronto, however, please note, this hotel just offers a basic place to rest your head and not set to the usual Marriott Standard. The Budges

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTr0tter05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott with my husband and 3 year old daughter. The lobby was nice. Check-in smooth. Rooms were spacious and updated - flat screen tv, newer furniture. Our only complaint is that the bed wasn't very comfortable. We had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. The meal was pricey, but well worth it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experiance at Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Naresh537
Reviews.Content: Hi , I stayed at this hotel for 85 days. I felt like staying at Home. Nice breakfast , and weekly 3 days complimentary snaks in the evening Every day the room clean and the towels will be changed. To keep body Fit they have a GYM also and Swimming pool in side the Hotel. It was nice expeiriance for me at this Hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “evening and over night staff are clueless”
Reviews.Author: Seanmtl
Reviews.Content: No room service and no suggestons other than one Pizza joing and one Chinese Restaurant. When the delievery person showed up they would not let him up to my room. I travel 4 times a month and this is the first time this has happened. I knew more about takeout/delivery in the area than the evening Front Desk staff and Manager. Night Manager was really underqualified. 4 star rating ony applies to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loyalty Misplaced ... poor service for repeat business customers”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveller6
Reviews.Content: Until mid Dec 2010 I stayed at this hotel (avg. weekly for a year) for business in the area and a long standing participation in the Marriott loyalty program. There are elements about the hotel such as the lounge staff, the staff in the Trios restaurant and location that are above average. However repeated service problems with housekeeping created unreliable service experiences. Repeated, constructive attempts to have the service failures and lack of reliability corrected were not appreciated or taken onboard. On the third occassion of no towels for a morning shower, I lost patience. The hotel served up a late apology but no offer to adjust the bill or award points to compensate me for showering off property so as to attend business meetings. I was relucant to leave this Marriott property due to location and decades with their loyalty program but reliable service comes first. Beware. Nice location, good restuarant but housekeeping service is hit and miss. There are a number of hotels in the area with comparable location and much better, reliable service. Loyalty programs create switching costs but eventually it is all about service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb sleeping quality”
Reviews.Author: LE_FTL
Reviews.Content: The Downtown Marriot is good for exploring the city since everything is within walking distance (if you do not mind to walk a bit across a city which I think is the best way to get the vibe of a city). We love the lobby with the huge centered fireplace (OK, no true fire, just gas but still very cozy and close to the bar) and the beds are one of the best we've ever slept in - huge, comfortable, good linen and very clean. We'll come back (although it is not cheap...).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed .. only 1 noisy restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: MunnyMan
Reviews.Content: First impressions: Check in area very stark and not very warm or inviting. Individual â€˜podsâ€™ where each clerk has to stand up all day (no chairs) confuses the guests who donâ€™t know where to line up. As platinum elite with 111 Marriott stays so far this year, I asked if there was a possibility of a room upgrade and she said they were full and there were no upgrades available. A maid later told me when asked that they werenâ€™t very busy and certainly not full. The bar and open restaurant were almost empty too, so I suspect the check in clerk lied. We got an ordinary king bedroom with a view into another building. Because it was a Friday check in the Concierge Room was not open, so I asked if platinum elites got breakfast included and she said they never do that. Room internet was wired only and very expensive. There was WIFI in the lobby bar. The rooms have HD widescreen TVâ€™s but no HD channels to watch. Strange. Also had no HBO or movie channel and was told that was because they wanted us to rent movies in the room for $18. No mini bar. Room Service is outrageously expensive â€¦ and the servers make sure you know that their tips are not included â€“ if so, why do 3 little pancakes cost $17 and another $5 for coffee? Or the All American/Canadian breakfast $20 â€“ about $6 more than most Marriottâ€™s? Valet parking was $30 with in & out privileges. There isn't much near the hotel but the Eaton Centre shopping mall, a very large complex and you can walk through to it from the 2nd floor if you're into shopping. I am surprised that this rather large hotel only has one dining room, Trios Bistro open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Itâ€™s right beside the very noisy bar area. It is not what I would consider an â€˜intimateâ€™ dining area at all, in fact there are long tables for people to sit at, with booths along the side. The poor ambiance made me concerned about eating there, but we tried the crab cakes and flat bread appetizers, fish & chips and their steak/bacon wedge salad entrees, and they were superb. Great food. The setting is really unfortunate but I guess this isnâ€™t a flagship Marriott anymore â€¦ they used to have a great JW Steakhouse which was dinner only and very dark, intimate and comfortable but itâ€™s now just a meeting room. Too bad. The second night we took a taxi ($7) to Ruthâ€™s Chris in the Hilton hotel â€¦ What a lovely place! Servers very friendly and professional and outstanding steaks/seafood. Highly recommend it. We toured the Hilton lobby and it was much more impressive than the Marriottâ€¦and they also had at least 1 more high level restaurant there. We will stay there next time instead of the Marriott Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, the rest is like always at The Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jetleggedcoroner
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a good conference centre where I spent most of my stay. It is not so pleasant because it is in the basement without natural light, not the best to spend a a week in. The rooms are beautiful as always at the Marriott. There is a nice gym on the roof where you can do a little exercise looking at the city from above: a beautiful landscape. If you like walking, the location is convenient for exploring the city, the bay area, the market and the hockey hall of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping spree to TO - Perfect Location !!”
Reviews.Author: lynne564
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend at the Marriott Eaton Centre. It was very easily accessible by road. On arrival, the front door staff couldn't have been more helpful (hey, Jimmy !!) Check in was quick, easy, and again the staff were very helpful. Our room was very nice, we asked for a lower level and got it with no problem. The hotel has indoor access to the Eaton Centre, which is great - you can come back to your room for a break any time. We didn't make use of the hotel restaurant, as there are so many great restaurants in the neighbourhood - the staff are only too happy to recommend places and make reservations for you. For a Downtown hotel, I would give this a 5 star for friendly and efficient service. Would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great hotel in a central location for shopping/entertainment. No free internet in your room, but free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 930am for a conference, checked in & I was lucky as a room was available, unlike some of the other conference goers. Carlos at check in was very friendly. Obtained a king room, floor is being renovated, hallways smelled of varnish. The room is a nice size, the bed is very comfortable, couch with table in room. Room was very clean. Bathroom is large but I found very basic. I obtained the$15.99 internet package which includes long distance & local calls. Received my account & was charged for every call. Called front desk, & issue was resolved. The gym is located on top floor with wonderful view of skyline consisted mostly of ellipticals & treadmills which was fine with me, complimentary fruit available in the gym. The location is great since next door to eaton centre & all the downtown attractions. Parking is $25 a day, lots of parking lots nearby if you want cheaper parking. Swimming pool appeared to be a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: alpenmicho
Reviews.Content: We had family coming in from the U.K. and decided to choose the Marriott Eaton Centre for its location. We wanted to give them a little taste of downtown Toronto and I think this place helped us accomplish that. I found the hotel very overpriced when we booked it a few months ago but was able to take advantage of a $139 advance prepaid rate that came up a week before our stay. The room was never charged until our stay though. I found all the staff very friendly. The hotel's public areas are very nice. There's a sitting area with beautiful cosy fireplace and a bar with overpriced drinks costing around $7 each. We were there on a Friday night. The bar wasn't very busy. The room was clean, nice good quality furnishings and comfortable. No complaints here. I looked all over the bed for bed bugs....none found. Eaton centre was a minute walk away. I'm not sure if there was indoor mall access but we just went out back, through a little courtyard with an old church in it. Lots of security around this area. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance including Eggspectations where we went for breakfast which was really good. In room internet cost extra, which I find ridiculous since most moderate price hotels include this in their price today. The only drawback to staying here is getting to the hotel. Figure out your directions beforehand via Bay St. as this area of Toronto is full of one-ways and the traffic is crazy...so if you miss your turn....kiss a good half hour goodbye. Parking is a little steep at $25 per night but they allow you to leave your car in the lot until 6pm of your departure date.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: fabianannoyed
Reviews.Content: Your review Rated 5.0 out of 5.0Rated 5.0 out of 5.0Rated 5.0 out of 5.0Rated 5.0 out of 5.0Rated 5.0 out of 5.0 Avoid this hotel like the plague!â€Ž - â€Ž - Today Do not be fooled by the suits and smiles that greet you at this hotel! Behind that veneer is some pretty bad food and service and really incompetent management that is defensive and obtuse when problems occur. Some examples: 1 Greasy food. I ordered the Trios Benedict and had to run to the bathroom five times after breakfast 2. Housekeeping broke a ear piece of an audio set which I had borrowed from a colleague as well as disconnected my laptop from the power source. As a result, I lost some files and had to spend five hours having to re-create those documents. Further, when I complained, I had to deal with several layers of really defensive and obtuse management with comments such as "Oh, housekeeping does not do such things!" Even more frustrating was when the Event Planning Manager Jack H (muttonhead) arrived along with a security agent(chucklehead) to my room to take a report of the damage done. Muttonhead was very irritating, trying to tell me that the breakage was only cosmetic as well as they would have to check with housekeeping which could take a day or two before confirming the incident, i.e. after I departed from the hotel. I find it hard to understand how a housekeeper on minimum wage with poor job security will admit to these mistakes. More interestingly, it has been a week and I have not heard from the hotel. Muttonhead was so audacious, that despite my obvious frustrations with him, he told me that he hoped that the hotel would welcome me soon once again! 3. 'The suits and smiles' protect the higher layers of management from hearing the real issues that guests face. When I tried to speak with either the General Manager Mark or the Service Director Steve with regard to a problem with booking, I was given various excuses by different people which were inconsistent. i.e. one person said that the Service Director had left for the day and another said that the Service director was in a meeting and would call me when he was out of the meeting, which of course never happened! I have platinum status with the Marriott brand of hotels, and if this is the experience that I faced, I can only shudder to think of how other guests get treated at this hellhole. 4. The hotel did not inform the guests of the "nuit blanche" or festival night that was occurring all around the hotel and resulted in barricades being raised, such that taxis could not reach the hotel. As a result, my very frail mother had to walk seven blocks on the Saturday night to get back to the hotel, only to find that our room key would not let us into the side door of the hotel. Thanks to another guest who saw our plight, he approached the door from the inside of the hotel and we were able to get in. The night management led by Mr Suda and another associate at the desk provided similar obtuse comments claiming that some of the revellers had jammed the door. If that was the case, how were we able to eventually get in?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Obeltran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Eaton Centre (large mall) and close to several attractions and restaurants in downtown. It is also close to the metro station and Hard Rock Cafe, where all tour buses pick up their guests. Also check for the free WIFI in the hotel lobby, in the room you have to pay for the standard 24 hour rate. The pool and hot tub are excellent to relax after a long day of walking. I also recommend to dine/lunch at the CN Tower; the views are incredible and the food is excellent; very good value and you skip the lines and don't pay the entrance fee.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a NEW Business Center - Not up to ppar with other Marriotts in the area”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyp20
Reviews.Content: I am an avid business traveller and stop in Toronto quite often. I made the mistake of chhosing the Eatons Center location over the Bloor or Airport locations I usually stay at. For business use the hotel gets a C, it was a poor service compared to the others. The rest of my stay was great but definately need to get a new system in place for business travellers.. Id recommend Hilton Downtown or Marriott Airport Locations for Business Trips. Dean

Reviews.Title: “NOT A GOOD FOR BUSINESS TRIPS”
Reviews.Author: NYCentertainment
Reviews.Content: We were working on an important project. We could only connect one computer to the internet at a time in any room. There is no wifi in the rooms, only the lobby. They charged us 17 Dollars for the internet a day.. which would have been fine had there been a fast wifi connection or multiple ethernet connections in the room. Not very convenient to go down to lobby all the time...Staff was not at all helpful in this matter... A sidenote: the room when we arrived was not vacumed and was not clean. Poor QC here. They did resolve this quickly though sending housekeeping....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danpearson
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto for our Honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The room was very comfortable, great facilities in the room with recent modernisation. It was connected to the Eaton Centre which was great for meals and shopping and close by to some great shopping in the local area. We walked to the CN Tower and Hockey hall of fame which were really easy to find but there were always Taxi's nearby if you don't fancy the walk (20 mins) Overall it was a great stay, very helpful and friendly staff, nice modern and clean room and great location. For the vegetarians reading there is a great Buffet style restaurant a few streets down which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott quality in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Toronto over fourth of July weekend, and was very glad I chose this hotel. Excellent location directly next to Eaton Centre, Yonge Street and City Hall, delightful room and furnishings, spacious bathroom, outstanding restaurants and other facilities...a fantastic stay. If you have the opportunity, choose a concierge level room. Stop overthinking....this really IS a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rlost
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on Saturday around 4:30 p.m. a full hour and a half after the stated check-in time. I was told that there were no rooms available because the cleaning staff was behind because of all the late check-outs that day. Without apologizing or offering any compensation I was told I would have to wait for my room to be cleaned. When I asked how long I would be waiting I was given a very vauge answer, "it could be 10 minutes, it could be an hour" again with no apology for the wait.
