I waited in the lobby and watched as serveral guests who arrived after me were given keys and did not have to wait to get a room. I had dinner reservations at 5:45 and was planning to change in my room for dinner. I waited until 4:55 and went back to the front desk to ask how much longer I would have to wait because I had dinner reservations. The woman laughed and said, "it hasn't been long enough for a room to be cleaned yet." I asked if there were any other rooms available, so she checked and all of a sudden they had a room for me. However she was reluctant to give it to me because it offered "more amenities" (I still haven't quite figured out what those amenities were, because the room I ended up in seemed standard). What horrible service, to not get a room until a full 2 hours after the stated check-in time with no apologies is ridiculous, especially when it is getting closer to dinner time and people have made plans. I have never experienced this lack of service at any other brand of hotels. The next day I called and asked for a late check-out, I was told it would cost me an extra $75 to stay 2 hours after the stated check-out time. So the hotel can delay my check-in by 2 hours without giving me any type of discount, but I would have to pay for my extra time, how ridiculous. The hotel itself was nice and the bed was comfy. I won't be back though, I've been a loyal Starwood Preferred Guest, up until this stay, and will now continue to be as I have never exprienced such disregard for a guest at a Starwood brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacking customer service in some areas!”
Reviews.Author: martManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice during June at this hotel, the first week we got married there in our suite which was not in any way recognised by the hotel! We did mention this in our original reservation and to several staff during the stay. Paid regular rate for suite but was told that we did not have access to the concierge lounge. Will not do so again. This is the first Marriott we have stayed at where access was not allowed despited staying in and paying for a suite. On returning the 2nd week, no recognition that we had stayed there 5 days earlier. Staff in the restaurant very helpful and friendly. Charges for inroom internet in this day and age are ridiculous. Forget breakfast if its not included in your room rate. Expensive at $23 not including taxes and grats. We went to Eggspectations on Yonge Street (part of Eaton Centre) where you get a fab breakfast for around $16. Wish they had told us about the G20 taking place during our 2nd visit when we made the reservation as we would not have stayed. Would not return as did not feel welcomed and no recognition of our marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good representation of a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: canadachickadee
Reviews.Content: Great location for downtown Toronto. Friday AM I had surgery. We went to the Toronto Islands on sunday and when I was there- my stiches started to leak. By the time we got back to the mainland and back to the mall adjacent to the hotel- the shoppers was closed. We went to the front desk, showed the front clerk that I was bleeding and explained my situation. asking if she had some band aids or knew of a shoppers super close by. I explained that I had just had surgery and needed assistance. The front desk girl didn't seem to understand the situation and said "oh there is a shoppers 2 blocks from here." Again i treid to explain that i didn't really want to walk- especially in my situation and if the shoppers was not open for certain. She still didn't get it- and said-"well I'll call to see if it is open". finally another employee came by and I stopped hi a dn asked if he could help me. He was sooo helpful and got my a few bandaids in less than a minute. other issues- bathroom really not that nice, concierge horrible at recommending things to do or good resutarants or giving directions. Great place to stay for the location and comfy beds- but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, very clean and quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gonzocan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to Eaton Center, which is the biggest and best shopping mall downtown. Under that mall is the subway station, so you can actually get on the subway without ever going outside. There are tons of excellent restaurants close by for pretty much every taste and budget. The room I had was at the end of the hall, so it was exceptionally quiet, and the bed was great. The only slight knock I have is that the airport shuttle doesn't stop at this hotel. When I stay here, I generally take the shuttle to the Delta Chelsea, then walk the couple of blocks to this hotel (and enter off Bay).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: pem243
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a good deal via tripadvisor and hotels.com and I'm glad that I chose this hotel because its location was ideal. We could walk everywhere and come back to the hotel occasionally as well. The room was a good size and looked out over the church next door, plus it was useful to be able to go straight through into the Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “US Military/Government Employee Rate is not Per Diem”
Reviews.Author: RavenFL
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel in the main, however I booked a room without verifying the per diem rate for Toronto (It was a mistake to trust the posted rate) and had to pay for the overage. An amount that approximated about $500 US dollars. The confusion lies in the fact that they offer a seperate Canadian government rate ($189), and then a second for everyone else ($289). The second troublesome fact is that the standard rate at the hotel was $10 dollars cheaper for the same week ($279). Marriott costomer service confirmed that this was not correct, but left it up to the hotel to resolve. They're response demonstrated no concern for future business from myself, or my collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Comfort”
Reviews.Author: PittTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Marriott Eaton Centre. I had not been to Toronto for years and didn't realize how walkable most of the central city is, especially from this hotel, which is conveniently located just blocks from culture, food, shopping and transportation. The hotel staff was friendly and efficient, our room was clean and spacious and the amenities made it feel very upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At In Canada.”
Reviews.Author: Dave9988
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto with my son to celebrate his academic achievements in school. This hotel was extremely luxurious and the view was fantastic. It had an underground bridge linking it to the Eaton Centre Mall and the a subway station. I loved that stay and I don't think there is a better hotel in Canada than that Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyman56
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel... great room size and everything very comfortable. My wife and 2 young kids really enjoyed staying here. Hotel is connected to Eaton Center, which is great. Hotel is close to everyhting... staff was nice. Valet parking is $25, but that is sort of standard in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Every coin has two sides”
Reviews.Author: otzda
Reviews.Content: First 3 nights went smooth. Clean hotel, well located. On the last night I got some loud young neighbors. They got louder as the night progressed and started to smoke. Called the front desk and they sent security. Of course they party youngsters gave them the run around. Their party finished at 4am, and ruined my last night!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TacoMel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Marriott for 3 nights when in Toronto on business. I appreciated the restaurant/bar which served up a good meal after a long day of travel. The room was also excellent, as I was on the end and had a view of the CN Tower. This Marriott was also within walking distance of the Toronto subway, and the walk was well-lit and safe. The reason that I couldn't give a perfect score - in typical Marriott fashion everything is nickel-and-dime. The internet costs $16 per day and it's wired only, although this also includes long distance calls to the USA. This adds up for someone who needs to be connected. Tip - the Toronto Airport Express shuttle bus is a cost-effective mode of transport from the airport to the city. The hotel staff told me to get off at the Sheraton station. However the bus driver pointed out that the U. of Toronto Residence stop (the last stop) was much closer, just a very short walk between some buildings to arrive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerously close to shopping!”
Reviews.Author: DanceChikita
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing for the rate. Very clean, comfortable all over. The bed was just to die for - perfect sleep. Great pool (warm and clean) and hot tub (the cleaning guy let us stay late that evening - thank you!) Amazing service between the front desk, bell hops, and valet workers. I can't comment on the food or drinks offered at the hotel as we did not order anything at the restaurant or room service - it was pretty expensive. Room service breakfast was $20 for nothing too special. The hotel is connected to the Eaton center = dangerous!!! I could spend all day in a mall and just shop until I drop! There is a beautiful courtyard with cobblestones and a church between the outside of the Marriott and the Eaton center. Overall, I would definetly go back in a heartbeat and I will recommend this hotel to friends and family planning on staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: Priceline winning bid: $77/night (for two nights). Although there was nothing that really stood out about this hotel, it served its purpose for a weekend get-away with the family. We drove in from Ottawa and had a difficult time finding the hotel since itâ€™s on a difficult street to turn onto when youâ€™re downtown. There were lots of no turning signs as youâ€™re trying to get to the hotel, which can be frustrating. Once at the hotel, youâ€™re better off parking at the Eatonâ€™s Centre indoor parking lot next door ($6/day on weekends/holidays), which will save you a lot more money then parking at the hotel. The hotel building, grounds, and lobby didnâ€™t really impress me much, but we also didnâ€™t spend much time at the hotel either. The location is attached to the mall; interior access is a 5 minute walk and takes you into the 2nd floor of the Sears womenâ€™s department. It really wasnâ€™t planned well as the hallway can appear dark and isolated between the hotel and mall. But at least you have that option if you donâ€™t want to go outside. We ate at the restaurant, which was standard for this quality. It had high prices, decent food, and average service; nothing out of the ordinary. Lots of televisions at the bar for when you want to watch a game. Free Wi-Fi internet access in the lobby, but not in the hotel rooms (cost extra). The elevators are only busy during morning and afternoon. This hotel is a business hotel, so donâ€™t expect a lot of leisure luxury (such as quality shops, restaurants, spa, or pool). The workout gym is quite nice, with individual television monitors, water cooler, and free earphones. Itâ€™s 24 hours, which I love for business travellers. I really enjoyed the apple platter they had there, which was a unique touch to a workout gym. The pool is very disappointing, which appeared to be a small cube shape so I didnâ€™t even bother. The room is standard for this quality, but lacking in view if you get the wrong side. We had two rooms, a court yard room (quite nice) and a standard room facing another building; ask for the rooms with a nice view! It was clean and I never had any noise problems. The bathroom was lacking any wow factor, but at least everything worked (perhaps time for a renovation). Overall, the hotel is great for a trip to the big city. The location allows you to walk everywhere, but the hotel itself is not the selling feature. Iâ€™ve been to many hotels in Toronto, and would rate this one as good because of location but not great due to not having anything impressive about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location; we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ExPat_from_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just steps from the Toronto Eaton Center as well as other great shopping and venues. If you enjoy shopping, walking and people watching this is a great location. The hotel is bright, clean and well maintained. The lobby is very airy and bright and the staff is friendly and welcoming. The pool on the 18th floor is simple but nice with greenery around the pool. The hot-tub area is separated by a glass partition which provides some privacy to swimmers and hot-tubbers, alike. There is a nice outdoor terrace which offers some great skyline views of Toronto. We had brunch in the hotel restaurant, as a treat. The restaurant is pricey but, like the lobby, it is bright and nicely decorated and the food is top-notch. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for a conference and it was pretty good. The hotel is located at the heart of downtown Toronto and very close to where my conference was. The lobby was nicely decorated and the staff were nice. The check went smoothly and we got a room on the 5th floor. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was like any standard 4 star hotel room. The parking was very expensive, the cost was $25 a day. I would go back there again for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Hikerman2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one Saturday night while in Toronto for a weekend with my wife. Very nice hotel in the center of the city. The room was a good size with a king size bed and a pull out sofa if it were needed. My wife said it has one of the best work out rooms she has ever been in for a hotel of this type. I would have no problem staying here again. Obtained a AAA rate that was very reasonable. The self parking at the hotel's own garage will cost you $25 per night which I find kind of steep. But this is on par with must hotel parking in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: ohshoozannah
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Eaton Centre with a few minor quibbles. One is my usual complaint of charging the exhorbitant fees for internet access in the guest rooms...this drives me crazy that I can go to a Holiday Inn Express and get free wireless internet in my room but the higher end hotels charge for it. No free business center to print boarding passes, etc...pc's in business center charged almost $2 per minute!! Okay, enough on that rant. The room was decent size for Toronto and was very clean. The only negative for the guestroom was that the shower seemed to take an inordinately long time to achieve warm/hot water...literally 2-3 minutes. I wasn't in any particular hurry, but just am not used to waiting for hot water these days. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. I made a bed in the window box.”
Reviews.Author: Provida
Reviews.Content: I don't understand people's objections. I shared the room with 3 other girls and found it warm, plush and delightful. Then again, I'm used to staying on friend's couches or in hostels, so perhaps I'm not too picky. The linens were marshmellowy delight and the maids gave me countless pillows and duvets and sheets- and we made a bed in the windowbox. Yeah, that was awesome. I had fun. Sorry you other guys didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: priyankashah
Reviews.Content: We went there during our long trip in Canada. This was one of the best hotels to stay during our trip. A perfect location to stay in Downtwon Toronto and the best location to visit eaton, CN tower and other place. Would go there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gone_aforeign
Reviews.Content: This Hotel exceeded all my expectations. It was very clean and staff were very professional and friendly. For my next trip, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “what can be expected of a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: zipi64
Reviews.Content: NIce setting and location, great service and relatively moderate prices (for a Marriott)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: bfranco01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights during a medical conference. The hotel location is great for walking to nearby attractions. Is close to the city train system as well. The lobby and room are very clean and modern. I have no complaints about the room at all, the bed was very comfortable and the sheets very clean. We used the hotel limousine a few times, the hotel told us the limo was $55 for two people to the airport, however when we got to the airport we were charged $65. The lobby had free wireless internet, a nice restaurant (although a bit pricey). This is not the cheapes or most expensive hotel in Toronto but it's well worth it. Comfort, location and service was great during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not impressed with the room”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and the hotel is in a great location with the Eaton shopping mall next door. I did not like the room, typical nort american Marriott room which smelled like there had been many smokers in it. The curtains were closed when we arrived and when I opened them in the morning there was just a tiny little window which could not be opened to get some fresh air in. We ate a great steak in the hotel restaurant. I do not think I would stay here again with the other great choices in Toronto but might come back for a steak :-)

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: shortnsweet77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the middle of everything- walking distance! Great service and amenities. Had popcorn and lemonaid every day in the lobby- a great way to welcome their guests! Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: f2photo
Reviews.Content: I liked the fruit basket every day. This was a three day trip that turned into a 3 week stay. Since it was winter I liked that there was tunnel access to the underground entrance to the mall (with many restaurants) and the subway. The mall was certainly the nicest part of the stay. Well, there was the fact that as an American citizen, the mall had Grouchos cigar shop where I could legally buy and have a good Cuban cigar. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice looking hotel, shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: scrapyardnow
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a typical hotel of its type, very smart, clean and modern, the staff are excellent, the facilities are top rate, but unfortunately the sound proofing is dreadful. We stayed 2 nights at the end of september and the first impressions were wonderful, the room was large, good bathroom, plenty of big fluffy towels and amazingly clean. However when we tried to get an early night all we could hear was the neighbouring rooms television blaring, then people slamming doors, talking from the rooms next door, infact you could hear the neighbours coughing in the night! Luckily the hotel wasnt too busy otherwise the noise would have been much worse. The breakfast buffet is top rate and the service is swift and generally excellent, however if you're a light sleeper try a more substantially built hotel, not one thats got walls made of cardboard!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference in the hotel so we basically had no choice when it came to picking a hotel in Toronto. Check-in : Everything went accordingly to plan. We were given our king size room which we had booked months earlier. Room : The room was just another hotel room , nothing flash but it was comfortable. The room consisted of a king size bed , small settee , coffee table and working desk with internet connection. The bathroom was on the small size with shower over the bath. Adequate toiletries were supplied. I actually like the aromatherapy orange ginger body lotion and managed to take a bottle home with me. Breakfast : A good selection with a chef cooking omelettes. Bar : We used the bar area frequently for pre dinner drinks and also returning home in the evenings. The staff were very efficient and friendly. Overall : The Marriott Hotel served a purpose and we had a comfortable stay. Our rate due to the conference was very reasonable so no complaints. The Eaton Shopping centre can be easily reached from the hotel. We also experienced a false fire alarm which was disconcerting as it took quite some time for us to get through to the receptionist to see whether we should proceed down the fire stairs or stay put..

Reviews.Title: “Reliably good Marriott in great Toronto location”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Eaton Centre Marriott is like big-city Marriotts everywhere - not terribly exciting and somewhat generic, but with a dependable comfort and service level. And the location is hard to beat. This particular Marriott is attached to the Eaton Centre, a massive downtown shopping mall that stretches several blocks and has TWO SUBWAY STATIONS! It's right in the center of downtown Toronto, close to the financial district just to its south, the cheesy/sleazy (by Toronto standards) Yonge Street commercial strip and the elegant Yorkville area to the north. Chinatown and Kensington Market are a few blocks (or short streetcar ride) to the west, the harborfront to the south, and everything is easily accessible by public transit. The hotel has a handsome, relatively understated lobby. It's Porte Cochere is off Bay Street, and it's linked to the Sears store in the Eaton Centre. The large, comfortable rooms are very Marriott in appearance, with soothing taupe color schemes. They also feature great flat-screen TVs, and large bathrooms with the standard Marriott toiletries. The Marriott beds are uber-comfortable. But you could wake up in just about any Marriott anywhere and not know the difference. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant or order room service - not in the multicultural, ethnic dining sensory overload that is Toronto. (For breakfast, go to Eggspectation in the Eaton Centre. It's great, though a half-step below its Montreal counterpart.) For transit purposes, and Toronto's transit system is one of the best on this continent, the hotel is linked to the Eaton Centre near the north end, which means the Dundas subway station is closest. The Queen station is at the south end of the mall. Also, the Bay Street buses and Dundas streetcars are just outside the hotel's front door.

Reviews.Title: “Large Recently Redone Rooms in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Roswellowner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in this hotel on vacation. The weather was beautiful in mid-September. The hotel is around the corner from the Dundas stop on the subway and has a walkway on the second floor to the Eaton Centre shopping centre which also connects to the subway. There are many casual restaurants in the Dundas subway stop area and a Scotiabank ATM for which there is no charge for Bank of America customers. Also on the second floor is a combined business center and gift shop that is open from 7 am to 11 pm. Although there is a charge for use of one of the computers, I believe it is only $2.99 for up to 5 minutes. Our room looked like it had just been redone with new looking carpet, furniture, and wallpaper and the airconditioning worked perfectly. The beds are the Marriott latex beds with feather toppers and were very comfortable. Perhaps the earlier reviewer got the room that had not been redone. There is a buffet breakfast for $21 per person but the room service Canadian breakfast is only $17 per person and there is no automatically added service charge. We enjoyed this all three mornings and it always came on time with the food hot. A Globe and Mail newspaper is delivered every morning and another Toronto newspaper and USA Today and the Wall Street Journal are available for free at the restaurant entrance. There is a large countertop for the sink in the bathroom and plenty of hot water and sufficient water pressure. In Toronto the subway goes to most places tourists would like to visit. We walked from the hotel to the Toronto Art Museum. We took the subway to the Royal Ontario Museum and the Gardner (Ceramic Museum) across from it, and also took the subway to Union Station where you board the trolley for the harborfront which has several attractions including the new Inuit art museum. Across the street from the Gardner Museum is Bloor street where the deluxe shops and many restaurants are. Downpoints were minor: 1. If you pour yourself a cup of coffee at the restaurant to take back to your room, they ask your room number and charge you for it; 2. When we went to the restaurant about 7:30 pm for coffee and dessert, the waiter seemed too busy chatting with the other staff to take our order and bring it, and bring the check. Needless to say, he got no tip; 3. The Eaton Centre is enormously big but really just filled with chain stores and rather basic food court type restaurants. It does have a Shoppers Drug Mart to pick up necessities, but is not really worth visiting for much else. The shops at the museums and the Craft Council shop in the Bloor Street area are very nice, filled with gifts, books, and original art.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding downtown hotel with great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: nativenewyorker9
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Eaton Centre provided service at its best. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel's downtown location is convenient for public transportation and adjacent to the Eaton Centre Mall. The mall can be accessed through the hotel without going outside. The hotel also has a nice indoor pool and hot tub for relaxing. My wife enjoyed the gym which had new and excellent machines. The rooms seem to have been recently updated and are well kept. Only downside was at 2am someone decided to light a cigarette in a stairwell and set off the smoke alarm causing all of the hotel guests to be evacuated. One guest's inconsiderate action should not reflect upon the property. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger54
Reviews.Content: After staying in a very basic, barely 2* motel in Niagara Falls, ON for 2 nights, I was very happy to check in to the Marriott Eaton Centre and walk in to my beautiful room. I never wanted to leave it! The king sized bed was very comfortable and had plenty of feather pillows and a down comforter on it. There was a loveseat to put my suitcase on, a huge desk with plugs for a computer or chargers, excellent lighting , a big, flat screen TV with tons of channels, a closet with doors and a light in it, a coffee & tea kiosk-type stand with coffee pot, coffee, tea & all the fixings and a spacious bathroom. The bathroom had Bath & Body Works amenities, a curved shower bar, plenty of hot water and not too bad water pressure (although I think a regular shower head might have had better pressure than the rainforest one they had) and enough towels. There was even a hair dryer in a bag hanging on a hook in the bathroom! I got to the hotel about 11AM and was able to check in to my room right away, which was a bonus. There is a clastrophobic parking garage below the hotel (CAD $22/day + tax) that offers in-and-out privileges to hotel guests. They have an indoor pool, fitness center, friendly concierge person and very nice front desk staff. One of the hotel's best features is that it is just a few steps away from the Eaton Centre, a big, upscale, shopping mall with plenty of shops and restaurants. Plus the hotel is 2 blocks away from Yonge Street, where there are many other restaurants and shops to choose from. It is in a GREAT location! If you are looking for a reasaonably priced resturant for dinner, try Mr. Greenjeans. For breakfast, Eggspectations (fab eggs benedict!). Toronto is a wonderful city to visit and the Marriott Eaton Centre is a great place to stay. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “grim”
Reviews.Author: minihally
Reviews.Content: I cant believe that we stayed in the same hotel as the other people who have reviewed this place. It is probably the most depressing hotel I have ever stayed in. To start with the decor in the rooms is dreadful; mustard coloured walls, a mustard coloured 3D (dont ask) carpet, mustard cloured bed throws and an artexed ceiling only just over 7 feet over our heads. The effect in the small room was to feel as if the ceiling and walls were closing in on us. To compound this the air conditioning didnt work properly and we couldn't open the window. The bathroom was the highlight, fairly basic and clean but small with meagre towels and toiletries. Breakfast was reasonable but unremarkable and the service very hit and miss. The pool was pleasant enough for our daughter to play in but would be much to small for exercising in. The location is reasonable but quite a long way from the waterfront. During our recent trip we stayed in 5 hotels in Canada and this was by far the worst. I do recommend dinner at the 360 resturant in the CN tower, a wonderful experience especially as the sun set. If you have children under 8 they will love the fairground at centreville on the islands but avoid Wonderland unless you have teenage children who can go by themselves, the queues were over an hour long for many rides and it feels bleak and bland.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: youkaygreen
Reviews.Content: Writng this in the lobby where the wireless connection is free. As the previous writer says, yes it is a bit pricey for the wired connection in the room. Wife also agrees that the beds are a bit soft! Location close to Dundas square and its direct connection to the large Eaton Mall is ideal. Parking expensive but about the norm for downtown. Would also reccoment the CN tower 360 restaurant. The meal includes the rather pricey elevation to the top plus you get to jump the queues (70mins today!!)

Reviews.Title: “Phils vs. Blue Jays, Toronto is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: kushmoney
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very nice hotel, great lobby, nice bar, rooms were clean but small. Windows did not open either. Cons: Not very close to everything, and Toronto is darned expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stndard Marriott qualities and convenient; but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: whittimere
Reviews.Content: Excellent rate of 3 nights for the price of 2 provided a huge room with ample storage facilities, Plasma TV and safe. Spoltessly clean. Bed rather soft for me. Internet connection in room rather pricey. Decent, but small 18th floor pool and gym overlooking the City. Restaurant OK but slow; nothing special. Housekeeping had a habit of knocking the door to see if all was well - morning, afternoon and early evening! Fire alarm at 5.20am and evacuation was well handled although muddled about the return to the rooms - no problems with that becuase the staff made sure you were out of the hotel and the Toronto Fire Brigade were there in an instant! Suprised a fellow traveller thought the fire alarm was a mark against the hotel! I was irritated by the fact that on the last morning, you are deemed to have checked out (so no more charges can be posted to your room) after they provide the statement of account! It means breakfast on the last day is either cash of charge card. Hotel is well placed fo shopping , Dundas square and all the tourist attractions Toronto has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservations, 5.20 am fire alarm, faulty keys -- a horror show”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: Now here's a hotel I am never, ever going to stay in again. The Marriott Eaton Centre is a large property right in the heart of downtown Toronto, where my wife and I were attending a wedding. I chose it because I generally like the solid build quality of Marriotts (the rooms are usually nice and quiet) and the service is professional. The tone of our dreadful stay was set right from the start, when the front desk clerk informed me that someone had cancelled our reservations. I had requested two adjoining rooms with a connecting door but these were now gone. The only ones she could offer me that had the connecting door were still not clean, so I accepted her offer of two adjoining rooms. In my world adjoining means right next to each other. In Marriottland it means two rooms separated by the entrance to the emergency staircase. There were about seven yards from one door to the next. The rooms were clean and quiet, but short on amenities. There wasn't even a shoe shine cloth, while the shampoo and soap were basic and the towels were pretty small. Right away one of the room keys stopped working, so we had to get it replaced. The elevator doors are about as friendly as sharks' jaws and we had to jump in and out each time to avoid being hit by fast-moving metal. At 5:20 am the next morning the fire alarm went off. We stumbled downstairs and were mystified by the completely incomprehensible announcements over the intercoms on each floor. I mean, the bells were ringing, the place could have been on fire, and all you could hear over the intercom was "Attention mumble splutter garble fire mumble mumble fizz wait". We made our way to the lobby and found no one in charge. One poor front desk clerk was answering guests' calls one by one and was too busy to talk. So we all milled around waiting for the fire engines to arrive. After a while I could see people lining up for the elevators so I asked the clerk whether it was safe to go back up. Yes, he replied. Yet the hotel did not make a single announcement to this effect. Overall, this was a hugely unimpressive performance. The next day there were huge line-ups for breakfast, since the room set aside for hungry guests appears to be pretty small. One of the other guests told us that he'd read on another traveller's forum that this hotel has had problems with the fire alarms going off. By this time I was super keen to leave, but we were having more trouble with one of the room keys, which also doubled up as the exit ticket from the downstairs parking lot ($22 Canadian a night for self-parking). So of course, when I tried to get our car out of the garage, the boom wouldn't open. I pressed the intercom and when the other person answered, I explained my problem. They asked for my room number, which I gave. "No, not the tag number, I need the room number." So I repeated the room number more loudly and very slowly. "I need the room number," she repeated, and round and round we went before I bellowed the number into the intercom. "Thanks for shouting," she said sarcastically. Well, if your system actually worked, I wouldn't have had to shout. Boy, were we glad to get out of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Mattiott”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, near everything one might need on a business trip and for doing some shopping. The room was comfortable, the staff was nice and helpful. I didn't use the pool, but it really seemed small. Overall, it was a perfectly nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Contemporary and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: NickysdadRF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre for 4 nights in early August. We're a family of 4, including 2 young children, so we stayed in a room with a king size bed as well as a sofa (with sofabed) on the 12th floor. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of downtown adjacent to Eaton Centre. The lobby is is stylishly decorated and modern as are the hallways and rooms. All of the furnishings including the carpeting seemed new. The room included a 42" flatscreen TV as well as a desk with an "In-drawer" safe. I found the room to be a tad small and drawer space was limited, but comfortable enough for a family of 4. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. Requests for pillows and blankets were responded to within minutes. We used the rooftop pool which was small, but very nice. The pool offers an "adult swim period" later in the evening. Most days, there were very few people at the pool. The subway is located nearby, as is Chinatown which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The CN Tower is an approximate 20 to 25 minute walk. I used Marriott Points for my stay, but this room seems to be priced at roughly $200 CAD nightly, which is fair price for a hotel of this quality. We opted for the breakfast buffet one morning which was excellent and included a wide variety of fresh items, including fruit, pastries, an omelette station as well as my favorite, eggs benedict. Beware -- it's very expensive. It cost our family of 4 (including two young children) over $70 for breakfast. If you would like the breakfast, please consider a room with the buffet included or you will pay dearly for your eggs benedict! I recommend this hotel for the business traveler or for short-stay family vacations. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT IN EVERYWAY”
Reviews.Author: joy12Blairsville_GA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Center for three nights this last week and wanted to add to the positive reviews that have been posted. The hotel is on Bay Street, one of Toronto's main downtown streets. You have a choice of valet parking or self serve (which we did and it was very very easy to access the car). Check in was very easy and Marsha, who checked us in, even went up to the room with us to make sure it met our needs. What wonderful service. The room was 1228 and had a lovely view of the church and courtyard on the side of the hotel. No noise from Bay Street, large windows and of course a wonderfully comfortable bed I have come to expect from Marriott. I met a housekeeper in the hall and ask for another pack of coffee which I was cheerfully given and every morning their after, our smiling housekeeper, Aprilyn, left extra packets of coffee, cream and sugar. After touring/sightseeing/visiting with a relative during the day it was always wonderful to come back to our accommodations for the evening knowing how nice they were. All the staff were extremely friendly and seemed to genuinely care about making our stay very nice. Toronto is a beautiful city with a lot to offer and the Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Center is a quality hotel with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel for the area”
Reviews.Author: otraveler
Reviews.Content: I was happy to get this hotel for $159/night - though internet was slow and added $16 dollars per day (though it included all calls - or so i thought until i got my bill and they had charged me $40 worth of long distance calls - they were promptly removed). stayed for conference at the sheraton centre - which was a short walk (less than 5 minutes) away. if you wanted to you could get there via the mall and the walk undergound. hotel room was small but clean and comfortable. TV was good, bathroom was clean/marble. location very central for downtown. toronto air express bus to airport was fast - take a $10 cab to get picked up at westin then $20 to take bus - o/w will sit on bus for 40 minutes before you even leave for the airport (still better than $60 taxi). concierge was fairly helpful, front desk staff was prompt and helpful. my colleagues staying at the sheraton said their rooms were old and not maintained and in some cases dirty. i think this is a good value for the area except for the internet charges which were high for such a slow connection.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: JamesHughes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice indeed, with good spacious rooms / bathrooms, well equipped public areas, and friendly and helpful staff. Parking was slightly expensive, but it tends to be with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Borderline 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NTraveler
Reviews.Content: Although certain elements of this hotel are 4-star, others are not. Better hotels can be found nearby. Check-in was fairly smooth. The room was comfortable overall, but the bed was a bit soft. The bathroom was small, with an outdated tub and vanity. Soundproofing is not very good. One can hear doors slamming from the halls, and showers from next door. For light sleepers, it may be hard to get a good night's sleep, especially on the weekend when many partiers arrive to their rooms at all hours. The breakfast buffet is good, but on a Sunday, there was a long wait to get a seat. At dinner, the entree price was high and the portion was small. The servers were inattentive. One seemed more interested in the baseball game on tv. There is an interior walkway to the mall next door - it connects to Sears. Internet access was $16, but the speed was slow. Self-parking was $22. On a weekend, the garage may fill up quickly. When returning at night, it may not be possible to find a spot. Two of four elevators were out, and there was a 10 minute wait to get to the lobby from my floor in the morning. I will probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SMCMichigan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Marriott Eaton Centre. The hotel was nearly 100% full, but check-in went quickly and we felt like the staff was taking good care of us. Our in-room safe wasn't working properly, but that was corrected while we went out for an afternoon exploration of Toronto. Our housekeeper was excellent and expressed her appreciation for the tip we left. One of the best things about this hotel is its location. It is connected to the Eaton Centre and there is a subway station there. We purchased a Saturday day pass on the Toronto Transit system and used it extensively to get around to tour Toronto. While there is a garbage strike going on, the city was still relatively clean and everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. We will certainly consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: deepcover
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a four night stay at the Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre, and I was completely satisfied with this hotel. I was in town on business, and chose this hotel for its location. I had to book at the last minute and was able to get an excellent internet rate over the weekend days. The room was great: quiet, roomy, comfortable beds and good ventilation. Enjoyed the spacious bathroom with lots of counter space for all the toiletries that my daughter and I had. I felt that the hotel wisely focused on things we needed, like a coffee/tea maker, black out curtains, and a daily newspaper, while eliminating the nonessentials like mini-bar and robes. The expansive fitness centre is on the top floor and features city views, as well as a small pool and patio. My only quibble would be that the business centre charged $3 for 5 minutes of computer time, but if you brought your own laptop, you could use it for free in the lobby. I have to mention the housekeeping staff who were very efficient, and cleaned up our room almost as soon as we left it. All the hotel staff were friendly and courteous. The location was an excellent one for us because our event was just across the street, but we also walked to dinner on Queen Street, had many shopping choices (itâ€™s connected to the Eaton Centre, or you can meander along funky Queen West) and itâ€™s close to the subway. While we didnâ€™t get the free breakfast others have mentioned, we ended up at a tiny place across the street called The Daily Brew. A very friendly owner and you can get three eggs, two toasts, bacon and coffee for $3.99, so we became regulars for four days. All in all, a very successful business trip by day and very comfortable nights at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: dcriscoe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really a beautiful place. Rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “The staff were very friendly....”
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my 16 year old, we arrived at 0200 and the front desk staff were most helpful. Got to our room (a king) to find it poor supplied with only one facecloth, two hand towels and a used bar of soap at the sink. We dined at the bistro, where our server was most hurried and tried to force us to have the buffet. In our two day stay, we noticed that the toilet would 'run' for a long time after flushing. It finally overflowed on Sunday morning before we left. I would stay there again, but only because of the proximity to Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Warmplacelover
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty average. It isn't a skycraper so most room's views are just ok, but besides for that, the staff are extremely courteous and welcoming. The room was only semi cleaned when we got there but the next day it was spotless after a note was left for the cleaning staff. The hotel walkway to teh eaton centre goes yes, to the Sears Women's lingerie department. IN the winter I'm sure this comes in handy but for the summer, it is much quicker and easier to just take the elevator to the lobby level and walk the trinity square, past the church and through the mall to either go to shopping or to Yonge street. The hotel is right beside Dundas sqaure and the main stop for our tour. ShopDineTour, which was very good. Look for the yellow double decker buses. They bring you to all the major attractions and you learn alot about the city this way. We had breakfast for 2 days of our stay for $10. Be careful if this isn't included in yoru room because it costs $22 a person for the buffet. The food is excellent, lots of selections and the wait staff is spectacular. Toronto itself is an amazing and diverse city. You will never run out of things to do, we had to stay an extra night and we still didn't finish everything on our list. If visiting in the summer, check out Harbourfront for a nice afternoon at the water. Walk, take the bus, or the subway from the Eaton centre Dundas stop and you're there in a few minutes. We did the CN tower, which is amazing but very crowded. We went around 8 so we could see the city with the sun, the sun setting and then the city all with its lights on, very nice. We also went to the Caso Loma which isn't that great at all. We went during a festival we did not know about and the castle was very crowded. There had to be a thousand people in the house. But the architecture is nice and the view from the bedrooms is specatular nonetheless. Book the Marriott Eaton Centre if you are looking for a great hotel with a good location and a fantastic staff. Parking is 22 a night which is basically the norm for downtown toronto. happy hotel hunting

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: tiger62z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during the memorial weekend. This place was very modern, clean, spotless, and felt like brand new. All the staffs we met were very courtesy, well trained. To our surprise, the hotel offered better currency exchange rate than those currency exchange counters on the street, it was usually the opposite way. The location of this hotel is pretty central in the downtown area. However, I might choose some place in the entertainment district or close to the harbour next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spent our wedding night there - had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met for the first time in the lobby of the Eaton Centre Marriott in June, 2006. When we married last week we wanted to spend our wedding night in the same place we first met. We had booked online (very easy) and mentioned at that time it was our wedding night. When we arrived we used the valet parking and had our bags brought to our room. This went very well. Check in was quick and, given the occasion, they upgraded our room to a suite and later brought champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. Pauline at Check In was great. The room was in great condition and there were flat screen TV's in both rooms. Room Service was quick and a turn-down service came by early in the evening. We decided to order a room service breakfast and it was excellent. The price was pretty competitive with some of the other places in the neighbourhood. Whenever we called Room Service for anything there was always a follow-up call to ensure we were happy with the service provided. We used the swimming pool and hot tub before we left. There was a generous supply of towels in the pool area. The gym and all the equipment looked to be in great condition. They provided free ear buds and chilled water for users. Checkout was fast and simple. All the staff we dealt with were great and helped make our wedding night a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: cal_dude7
Reviews.Content: After the disappointment of almost having to stay the weekend up the street at the Marriott Courtyard (wrote a review on that as well, see my profile!), I was able to have Marriott switch me over to the Marriott Eaton Centre for the duration of my trip and only had to pay an additional $20 per night. The difference was night and day. We were able to access the hotel through the Eaton Centre itself. The path is a bit hidden the first time you try (you have to go to the second floor of Sears/Eaton's and next to the woman's swimwear department there is a small hallway leading to the hotel), but once found is a convenient way to access both the mall and hotel without having to go outside. Once at the check in counter we were warmly greeted by the check in agent and were surrounded by one of the nicest hotel lobbies I have been in. As per usual with me I asked if there were any upgrades available. Unfirtunately there wasn't but I was told I would have a nice room with a courtyard view. Unlike the previous hotel we were to stay at, this agent was telling the truth and we ended up with an EXCELLENT room! The room was quite spacious. Once entering the bathroom was to the right, and there was a small shelf set specifically designed to give you space to make coffee and tea. Past the bathroom and shelf you then enter to main area of the room which was equipped with a very nice LG flat screen tv, office table with safe built in, a comfy couch, and the most comfortable bed I have had the pleasure of sleeping in! Apart from the actual room itself the hotel offers many areas in the lobby as well as various hallways to relax in modern styled couches and lounge chairs. The hotel restaurant is nice and offers a great breakfast buffet (try and get the rate that includes it for free if you can, otherwise it is over $20 per person!), and the bar itself is open till 1am (drink prices are a bit high for what you get, so if you are willing to walk, going somewhere on Younge may provide better value) Overall it was a great experience and really helped make our trip memorable and a pleasure. If you are looking for a premium hotel but not looking to spend on some of the really high prcies that come with properties like the Fairmont Royal York, this is a great pick, and will provide the best bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel! Location, Staff, Rooms, Fitness, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ontariogirl12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Marriott many times but this was our first time back since the renovation and it did not disapoint. Rooms were spotless, and big enough. The staff was great right from check-in with a "welcome back" from every employee starting with the valet. Special thanks to Danny for being so nice with the kids he was awesome! One of the best features of this hotel is its proximity to the Eaton Centre as it is connected with a walkway so you can leave your coats in your room and shop all day. It is also right beside Nathan Phillips Square, which has a skating rink all winter. The buffett breakfast which was included with our rate was good every morning and better than most hotels. The pool is small but sufficent. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Adirondack88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Had a room with a king size bed that was very comfortable. Also the rooms were extremely quiet which was great. No hallway noises at all. Excellent location close to great shopping and wonderful selection of restaurants. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nkereina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toronto Marriott Eaton Centre over Valentine's Day weekend. I originally had a reservation at the Courtyard Marriott on Yonge St, but switched it last minute when I found out that this hotel was connected to Eaton Centre where I wanted to shop. Check in was quick and efficient. When I made my reservation, I was told no king size beds were available but I ended up getting one without even asking. I also was able to check in about an hour and a half early with no problem. My room on the 10th floor faced Bay St but was on an angle so I could see into other people's rooms. I made sure to keep the curtains closed. The room was a good size... I wouldn't call it a suite but it was a good size. The bed was very comfortable. We went swimming in the pool. It was very small and warm but got the job done. There was also a nice work out facility as well. We also ordered a movie which cost $13, which is average price for hotel movies. The walkway over to Eaton Centre was really nice. We were able to leave our coats and boots in our room while we shopped because we didn't have to step outside at all. The walkway leads you right into Sears. It's also next to a gift shop in the hotel where they had all kinds of snacks and drinks. Check out went smoothly. Valet was great with my car. There was a 20 minute wait for the breakfast buffet which was $15. We didn't feel like waiting so we walked up the road to the Delta Chelsea for breakfast... we should have waited at the Marriot. We paid the same price, waited just as long, and it wasn't even a buffet over there. Only complaint was that it was really hot in our room, and in other parts of the hotel. We turned down the thermostat to 60 but it was still really hot. I had to sleep with no blankets. Overall, it was a good hotel in a great location. I redeemed my Marriott points to stay here for free, so I don't know if it's worth the price.. I think it's normally around 250-300 per night. But the location is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousMe
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in November as an add-on to a business trip. You can get to the hotel easily via the Toronto Airport Express Bus, and it's just $30CN roundtrip. It's a quick ride from the airport, and the bus lets you off at the Metropolitan Hotel about 2 short blocks away. Be aware, though--you will be the first stop on the way back and travel time will be a little over an hour. The hotel has a funny site and faces sideways--it's not too impressive when you walk up, but everything changes when you enter. It has a lovely, light lobby filled with professionals who are friendly and helpful! Every interaction I had with the staff was perfect. The property looks recently renovated, and the room was spacious and comfortable. Loved the recycling bins in the closet, due to Toronto's new recycling program. The restaurant was very good and reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant. The location couldn't be better. It's right downtown, next to Eaton Centre, the gorgeous Church of the Holy Trinity, and within walking distance to just about everything. We didn't rent a car and walked everywhere, including the Bata Shoe Museum, Royal Ontario Museum, Chinatown, Kensington Market, St. Lawrence Market, and the Brewery District. Sadly, we missed the reopening of the Art Gallery of Ontario by a week, but that's definitely within walking distance of the hotel. Kensington Market and the Brewery District were the longest shlepps and those walks might not be for all, but we really enjoyed them and had fun detouring through the nearby neighborhoods. I would stay here again in a minute--loved Toronto and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Marriott Experience”
Reviews.Author: 2LITravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre for a weekend getaway. The hotel is next door to Toronto City Hall and the Eaton Center Mall. Having the mall next door was a pleasant bonus. The hotel is within a 20 minute walk from most downtown sites in Toronto, including both stadiums. The hotel appears to have been recently renovated as the lobby was modern and the rooms were up-to-date. The bed was very comfortable, however there was not much of a view from our room. Staff was very friendly and efficient. Buffet breakfast was typical Marriott and very good, although the breakfast area could use some shades as it was very sunny and hot near the windows. We flew into Toronto and took the price fixed $50 taxi from the airport. I saw that there was an airport bus too, but don't know how close it came to the hotel. This Marriott will definitely satisfy a Marriott customer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place so much, I want to move in permanently!”
Reviews.Author: Ooblek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. From the moment we walked in the door we felt welcomed and comfortable. Check in literally took 2 minutes and we were on our way upstairs. Every hotel worker we encountered was friendly and helpful. At one point, we were looking for some info from the concierge, only to find that he had left for the night. The people at the front desk were more than willing to help us out with what we needed. The beds at the Marriot were SO comfortable I would have been ok with just lounging in bed all weekend and never seeing the rest of city! Not only that, but the rooms were spotlessly clean, the amenities were nice and our view was spectacular. The location couldn't have been better. There was a hallway that connected to the Eaton Centre. Of course, when you arrive at the mall, you're in the ladies lingerie dept. of a Sears store, which is a little weird...but other than that, it was handy. Lots of stores and restaurants in the area. The hop on/hop off bus stop was very close to the hotel and so was the drop off spot for the airport shuttle which was great. It was overall a wonderful experience - I'd highly recommend it to anyone. It's a nice clean, quiet hotel in a great area. I felt spoiled while I was there

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: instyleLive
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for one night in a 1 king bed room on 16th floor. Overall, we both agree that we had good time staying there and it was above average experience. Here is some details. Booking through the Marrott website was easy as always -- this is not the first time we did this. I always get all the details on a web and then call them, as a representative can confirm some reservation details during the reservation process. We bought Romance Package, which included valet parking and breakfast for two, as well as a bottle of sparkling wine in a room upon arrival. The arrival was friendly, easy and quick. The hotel carries modern design with a lot of square elements with a minimal modern-style decor (nothing wrong with that, just an observation..) Room was somewhat dull, especially comparing to other Marriott hotels we have been before. Montreal Chateau Champlain, which is of a more traditional European style would be a of a sharp contrast. Windows in the room were too small for the room of its size and there was no direct access to the window -- there was a desk for the whole length of it. However, the room was neat and clean and had everything in it. Restaurant requires a few special comments. It is not designed as a separate room, but rather as an integral part of the lobby/main floor. But not to worry, it actually fits quite nicely into the lobby design. The restaurant has a good and prompt service. Food was very good. I would rate the quality of the food as 95 (out of 100). Hotel service was also very good. We got to keep our vehicle in the hotel's parking for two hours after our check out, which was great as we strolled around the Eaton Centre and the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone -- from singles to parent with kids to adult couples.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights checking in on the 15th of August. Took me a few minutes to find the hotel entrance as I was driving and expected, for some reason, the entrance to be on Yonge. This was my fault not the hotel's -- did locate the entrace on Bay as I knew for sure that property was located adjacent to Eaton Centre. As a previous reviewer mentioned, the self park ramps are very tight even with a smaller car. The garage exit is also extremely steep making it a bit exciting for a user of a manual transmission. As I was in the garage approaching the elevator, a valet parking attendent advised me to take the stairs as the elevator was out of order. This necessitated a walk up two flights of stairs with luggage. Whether the valet was misinformed or the problem was quickly fixed, I am not sure, but the during remainder of my stay the parking elevator was funcitioning. After checking in after a moderate wait, I found myself in my pleasant room on the fifteenth floor with an underwhelming view north. All features of the room were clean and functioned without flaw. Decoration was in the well-standardized Marriott scheme. A few local photographs did provide some relief from the routine. Did not use the very small pool nor health club which was more inviting. Hotel gift shop on the second floor provided a nice selection of drinks and snacks in addition to the standard stock. Odd, but at 9:00am Sunday, they did not have any newspapers. The front desk did, however, supply one upon request, without charge. Access to Eaton Centre via the second floor was closed during my stay due to construction. Bar area was light and modern in decor and well-staffed. Wines by the glass were rather pricey. Breakfast is taken in the same general area with some tables looking out on a plaza in front of the adjacent historic church. Buffet breakfast looked inviting but the menu served to be satisfying and reasonably priced. Location is quite good adjacent to City Hall and Eaton Centre. More interesting tourist areas such as Yorkiville or the Entertainment District are a moderate (15 minute) walk away (or there is a subway stop nearly adjacent).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrg013
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from an excellent 2-night stay at the Toronto Marriott Eaton Centre. We stayed using Marriott Rewards points, and were treated exceptionally well from check-in to check-out. We arrived very early at the hotel (9:00 am) our first day. We noticed right away how beautiful the lobby is. It is spacious and very modern with plenty of comfortable seating areas. There is a nice raised area with a fireplace that I'm assuming would be lit in the winter. Of course, the room wasn't ready when we first got there, but the staff was very cordial and offered to rush the room cleaning and give us information on local attractions in the meantime. We parked the car and returned at regular check-in time after a full day of touring. One note about the parking: be careful of the sharp turns and steep driving you'll have to do for the self parking ($22 per night). The garage is a little bit difficult to navigate, with some spots that are virtually impossible to get into with a larger car. When we returned to check-in, we found the staff very pleasant again. We booked a regular 2 doubles room with rewards points plus a paid $30 per night upgrade to the concierge level. In the computer it was showing up as a $50 upgrade. After showing our confirmation, the desk staff was more than happy to make the adjustment, no questions asked, no need to deal with management. This impressed me. Our room was on the 7th floor. I believe that this level used to house the concierge lounge. Since renovations have been going on, it has been moved to the lobby level next to the restaurant. When we got off of the elevators (which were surprisingly fast our entire stay), the floor seemed to be under construction. There were sections of the wall that were blocked off and the carpet was covered with plastic in some areas. However, our room was further down the hall away from all of this and we didn't hear anything or have any problems with the construction. The room was gorgeous- everything was brand new. It was decorated in the new Marriott theme of golds and reds and the beds are some of the best you will find in the hotel industry. The tv was one of the largest I've ever had in a hotel room, and the desk area was large and had a nice array of power sources for the business traveler. The bathroom was on the small side, but still very functional and nice. The room itself was above-average in size for a city hotel room. Our view was of Trinity Church and other buildings in the area. It was probably one of the best views available- no room has a truly "great" view. We didn't use the indoor pool or fitness center, but I looked at both. They seemed pretty standard for a city hotel- nothing extraordinary, but definitely adequate. The concierge lounge is now located off of the lobby by the restaurant. The staff in there was wonderful- some of the best I've had at any hotel. The lounge was large and had nice hors d'oeuvres and snacks all day. For the breakfast, they allowed us to get the full restaurant buffet, which made upgrading a real value! We were treated exceptionally well by all of the staff- we even received a free tray of room service snacks at one point with a note welcoming us to the hotel. It was such a nice touch that made us feel welcomed and appreciated as Marriott Rewards members. The hotel location is great. It is across the street from City Hall and connected to Eaton Centre and Dundas Square (the indoor walkway was closed during our stay for renovations). As tourists, we found it very convenient to everything we needed to see. There is also a subway stop right at the hotel. We did the double-decker bus tour of the city through Grayline on both of our days in Toronto, and there were 2 stops within walking distance of the hotel. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. Everything was perfect, despite the fact that renovations are occurring. Every improvement the hotel is making seems to be for the better. It is a great property that I will return to: a true 4-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel as expected, but great staff”
Reviews.Author: theoldwoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just about everything you expect of a Marriott. The lobby is fresh and bright, interesting little â€œlecternsâ€� for the front desk staff, but they work OK. The room was average size, but the new flat-screen TVs do made it seem more open and less cluttered. Plenty of parking (not free), tunnel to the Eaton Centre, walking distance to interesting shops, nightlife, and all the city centre tourist spots like the CN Tower. The only downside was the bedding. The new mattress toppers on both beds were a dismal failure, and slipped over the edge every night, so not the most comfortable nights sleep. The staff were excellent, and obviously empowered to deal with all a guestâ€™s needs and not hand them off to someone else. For example, the guy who met us when we drove up unloaded the car, escorted us to the check-in, which was busy so he checked us in himself, and then took us up in the lift, all the while explaining access to the lounge, spa and gym location, etc. etc.. THATâ€™S exactly the approach that makes me want to stay at Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FeWenInRom
Reviews.Content: This Toronto Marriott is nice. The rooms are not as spacious as other Marriotts I have stayed at. However, I feel the location is great and there is a helpful staff. The Downtown Eaton Center Mall is right outside the backside of the hotel and there is a few restaraunts right there as well. If you walk up or down the street you will hit some nice shopping areas. I would stay here again. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: tassbox
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about hotel. Staff was confused as to the concierge lounge, but that was it. Beware of tight turns in for parking garage under facility. You may have a difficult fit. Modern facility, quiet. Highly recommend. Best to call property directly for best rates. Marriott website or other sites may not have best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a tad overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: mel_140
Reviews.Content: This place is very clean, its got THE MOST comfortable beds, and the location is great. The bathrooms were clean and the rooms have been updated. The hotel has a very modern look and feel to it. The rooms also have new big screen tvs which was nice. One of the things that make people willing to pay a lot of money for this place is because the hotel has a walkway that goes right into the eaton centre mall. It enters sears, and on your way through this hallway there is a giftshop and a cafe down the stairs. Its a pretty cool thing to be able to walk right into torontos biggest mall in just two minutes. The only downsides are is that for $250 a night, you dont really get your moneys worth. The pool area is quite small, and elevators, lobby is packed by noon, and there seem to be a lot of kids running around everytime im there, and the giftshop and cafe were very overpriced. Also a lot of the rooms face an office building, so theres not much privacy, because the curtains are very easily seen through, but overall if your willing to pay over 250 a night, your really only paying for the location and the walkway to the mall. There are 3 and 4 star hotels just down the street from this one, and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Trios, great service”
Reviews.Author: TexasMomH
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Marriott Eaton Center and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is modern and the lobby is inviting. In the lobby there is a lounge area surrounding a free standing fireplace that is enjoyable to sit around and chat. The restaurant ,Trios, has a menu with a variety of items (crabcakes, scallops, meatloaf, salmon and short ribs were amazing). Our dinner was memorable with a nice atmosphere, delicious food and the service friendly and helpful. We also had breakfast there, as when you pay for the concierge rate you eat off the buffet in the restaurant, which includes made to order eggs, etc. (great deal). Did not utilize the fitness center or pool, but looked nice and clean. Overall wonderful stay, will book again when I return to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: h0lidaysun
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, centrally located, great rooms and wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter. Toronto was cold so it was great to be so near the Eaton Centre and have quick and easy indoor subway access. The concierge was a big help especially since it was the Easter weekend and so much was closed. Have stayed here before and the rooms seem to have been renovated and updated. They are much less cluttered and cramped than I recall. Hotel seemed empty and the lobby is curiously unwelcoming. Breakfast was ovcerpriced and very average but not much other choice on Good Friday. Like the location, especially when travelling with teenagers interested in shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over (US) President's Day weekend-Friday to Monday. Check-in was smooth and the hotel had received my on-line request for a high floor and honored it. I chose not to pay for a concierge level room since the concierge lounge was closed most of the weekend. I got a discounted rate through the Marriott.com site and decided to take that rather than using points. The room was what most would call the "typical Marriott room." Excellent housekeeping and the usual amenities; plenty of room for one person. Bed comfortable; furniture, carpeting, drapes in good repair. Breakfast in the hotel each morning; buffet style with eggs cooked to order and nice selection of the usual breakfast items, breads, etc. The staff was absolutely wonderful both at the front desk and especially in the breakfast area. All very friendly and eager to please. Used the pool and whirlpool once; the area was clean and all the equipment in the adjacent fitness center in working order. The hotel is about one and a half blocks from the Dundas Subway stop which can be reached by indoor PATH walkway; hotel is adjacent to Eaton Centre and has an interior walkway to the Sears store next door. The front desk arranged for a private transfer to the airport on my last morning at 4:15 AM and that w ent without a hitch. Overall I was pleased with the stay and the location worked well for my planned activities.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: radas
Reviews.Content: Really liked my stay, it's right next to Eaton Ctr, room was spacious and modern. I got an extra couple of hours for a late check-out, so that was nice of them too. Nice and clean gym on the top, typical hotel breakfast available downstairs. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: GlennTheBaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 4 nights at this hotel and would highly recommend it as a base from which to explore Toronto and Niagara Falls. The lobby renovations did not negatively impact our stay and appear to be almost complete. The sports bar, 'Characters' did the job of the lobby bar during the day, serving drinks only but then around 4pm each day they began serving food from their bar menu. The hotel was very busy as the CFL Grey Cup was being played at the Rogers Centre on the evening of Sunday 25 November. Being from England, we didn't know a thing about the Grey Cup until we got to Toronto and people kept asking us if that was the reason we were visiting! We paid a shade over $100 Canadian dollars per night and our room was great. Nice and big with the most comfortable bed ever (as noted by previous reviewers), a large LCD TV and all the usual stuff you get with a Marriott hotel. The hotel definitely has something of a 'business' feel to it but its location means it is perfectly situated for leisure travellers too. There is a walkway which leads directly from the hotel to the Eaton Centre which in turn is connected to the PATH system of underground walkways. There are 2 subway stations accessible from the Eaton Centre too. The staff were all superb, plenty of smiles and only too willing to help. None of them would accept a tip - 'No thankyou, its all part of the service, sir' was the reply when I tried tipping the doorman or bellman. We paid a small amount to have a late checkout (6.00 pm) as we were not flying home until 11.00 pm and it was nice to be able to leave or bags in the room and then go back and shower before leaving for the airport. All in all, a most enjoyable stay in Toronto with the Toronto Marriott Eaton Centre as a perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back for the beds alone.”
Reviews.Author: honeysusie
Reviews.Content: Myself and five friends stayed at the Marriott last week for a short break. The hotel was in a great location, right in the centre of the city with easy access to everything. We had three rooms which were originally on different floors even though I had asked for adjacent rooms. When I pointed this out it was quickly rectified by reception and we were put on the same corridor. All the staff were very helpful and we had a great meal in the restaurant. Room service was promp. The rooms were very spacious with two double beds in each room. The beds are wonderful. I havn't slept in a more comfortable bed including my own at home and all my party said the same. You can buy the pillows and mattress toppers to take home. I would if I could have got them in my suitcase. Other people commented on the view from the rooms but what does one expect from a city centre hotel? It was either the little square at the back and the adjacent office building or the front of the hotel. We had a great time in Toronto. The hotel was exceptional. There was some renovation of the entrance hall going on but they have to do the work sometime. It is also one of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed in and I would certainly recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Unexciting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westby
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Marriott Eaton Centre while attending a conference. The hotel is centrally located - just a block from Junge St. and a short walk to University. Needless to say, the Eaton Centre is practically next door to the hotel. I should note that the Airport Express bus does not list the Marriott as one of its downtown stops, however one of its stops (the Metropolitan Hotel) is only a block or so from the Marriott. The lobby of the hotel is currently undergoing renovation (as noted on their website) which made for an unexciting first impression, however the room (1112) was tastefully decorated and fairly spacious for a downtown hotel room. My only negative comment about the room was the view - it looked straight into an adjacent office building. Hotel staff seemed to be competent and very pleasant, although my interactions with them were minimal. I paid a conference rate of Can$179 plus the various taxes and fees - this seemed a little high for what it was, although realistically I blame the US$ more than Marriott for this perception. Overrall, my room was a comfortable place to spend some time (I liked the large flat panel tv), while the rest of the hotel was unexciting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Eaton Center”
Reviews.Author: domandmeg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two kids ages 6 and 4 during Canadian Thanksgiving. The staff was outstanding, the rooms were a bit small but very clean and with the most comfortable beds. The kids loved the pool and I loved the fitness center with its complimentary headphones, oxygenated water and fresh fruit! Perfect location close to everything. Had a great stay and would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Eaton Centre convenient with nice touches”
Reviews.Author: SarTravelbug
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to post this positive review of the Eaton Centre Marriott in Toronto for a year now! My husband traveled to Toronto for business constantly for a few months this past summer and we made a vacation of a couple of weekends in the city. We loved the Eaton Centre Marriott - the lobby has a nice cocktail bar and good steak restaurant and with a modern art look. Being Marriott Rewards members, we got a lovely upgraded room with access to the concierge lounge and good views. The hotel was (obviously) part of the Eaton Centre so shopping and public transport were just steps away.
