If you have been to one Marriott, you know what to expect at basically all of them and that can be comforting when in a new place. This hotel was a nicer style than most and ranked up there with the downtown waterfront Seattle Marriott for style and a cool bar to chill at in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayvbee
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Marriott last minute. Check in was easy and the guy working was very nice. Best part of the hotel was the beds.. it was like sleeping on a cloud. The room is really spacious too. The location is great and theres even a walkway on the second floor that leads to Eaton Centre. The only problem I had with the Marriott was the pool upstairs is really small and housekeeping gave us a hard time when we needed stuff. The day we checked out, most of the hotel was being renovated so I expect that if I stayed there again there would be a lot of decor changes.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting stay in terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkelly8
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected, good check in, great location, nice room, good staff, etc....then about 11:00pm the fire alarms went off. They announced on the PA system that there was no emergency but about an hour later, the same thing. Not sure if that's a regular occurrence, but again, it's a nice hotel attached to the Eaton Center mall pretty close to the water (within walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Loooooved it!”
Reviews.Author: yankeebabe1988
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Marriott! Stayed there for a week during the Easter period. The location was great and right next to the shopping centre - The Eaton Centre. Forget shop till you drop, we kept popping back to drop off our purchases and go back to buy more! There are plenty of restaurants to choose from around the hotel, all in walking distance. I would particularly recommend the Baton Rouge just in the Eaton Centre. During the daytime there is an inside walkway into Sears from the third floor, which during the winter months, saves you getting frozen and then lumping your huuge coat around with you the whole time when you shop. The actual hotel was great! No complaints! We had two rooms with 2 double beds and they were both huge! They each had LCD flat screen TVs and the bed was the comfiest bed I have ever slept in! Perfect after a day of sub zero temperatures! The staff were very hepful, friendly and attentative to all our needs. On our last day, we were left a fruit bowl and a letter from the manager thanking us for choosing to stay at the Marriott which was a nice added touch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: J_S416
Reviews.Content: Stayed from August 3rd to 5th with two friends for Caribana Weekend; booked on Expedia at the last minute so I was a bit worried, but the price was fair, so I figured I'd take what I got. Check-in was a breeze; it took about 2 minutes and the front desk let my friend check his bag before-hand while he waited for me in Eaton Centre. I was told upon booking that the double beds may not be available; this was confirmed upon check-in. The room we were given had a King Bed and pull-out sofa. This was not a problem as there were only 3 of us - 2 shared the King bed, and 1 took the sofa bed. We were assigned a room on the 15th floor, which was beautiful. The decor was tasteful, flat-screen tv, VERY soft King bed, marble counter in the bathroom...we were quite impressed. The service at the Mariott was wonderful for the duration of our stay. We had forgotten toothpaste, and went down to the front desk to ask if any was available. They had personal-size packs sent up to our room both days we were there. Room service was not over-priced and it took about half an hour for our dinner to arrive on the Saturday evening, when we were too lazy to venture out for a meal. The food was excellent. All staff that we dealt with were courteous and professional. The only problem (and the reason for my rating of 4 rather than 5) for the entire weekend was that the fire alarm went off around 6:45 on Sunday morning and continued until about 7:15. This was incredibly annoying and extremely loud in our room. I understand that for safety reasons the alarm was necessary, but did not understand why the annoucements continued every 5 minutes advising that they were looking into the matter and would provide further information later. Needless to say, it was difficult to sleep after this. Other than that one tiny mishap, our stay was WONDERFUL and I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers, and would stay at the Marriott again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Linyo
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar here, so I did not choose this hotel. However, I was pleasantly surprised. I paid a rate negioated through the semiar of $189 CAN which I imagine is not anywhere near the "normal" price. I had an oddly shaped room so I can't comment on the room sizes, but had a great view onto Trinity Square and beyond. The room was quite clean, and the bathroom was huge - this one, at least, was much bigger than it needed to be - lots of empty space. Staff was friendly and helpful. Public areas were clean and welcoming. Food (breakfast and snacks) provided as part of the semimar was good, too. It is conveniently located next to the Eaton Center, which is essentially a big indoor mall - nothing here to knock your socks off, shopping-wise, but a nice diversion after sitting in a seminar all day! Only negative was the bathroom, with all it's space, and a sliding pocket door, did not provide a good noise barrier. Don't share this room with anyone with whom you're not comfortable sharing bathroom noises! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, Great Restaurant ”
Reviews.Author: sworl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a mini-getaway the weekend of April 28/07. We were attending the show WE WILL ROCK YOU and decided to stay at the Marriott Eaton Centre due to the close proximity of the theatre we were attending. The hotel is marvelous, their renovations are complete and they did a wonderful job, we had a room with king bed, great tv in the room and it was a very spacious room. I have to mention that the restaurant JW's located in the hotel, was great. The service was superb, our waiter (Ralph) was very courteous and helpful and friendly also, we couldn't ask for much more. The meal itself was extremely good, it is well worth your money to have a meal there, you won't be disappointed. I give this hotel high marks and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Colicita
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children, ages 3 and 5, stayed at the Marriot Eaton Centre for two nights. My husband and I agree the experience has spoiled us! The beds here were luxurious, with incredibly comfortable pillow-top mattresses and beautiful, crisp white bedding and duvets. The shower was terrific. There was no minibar in the room, but room service was readily available and there was a gift shop which sold just about everything you might have forgotten at home (in my case, moisturizer). Because we were too tired on our first night to start looking for a suitable restaurant for small children, we went to the sports bar in the hotel. Although the servers were extremely friendly and nice to our children, the service was ridiculously slow. The kitchen is on the other side of the hotel so all meals have to be carried from there to the sports bar! No matter, our kids were happy. There is a much nicer restaurant option in the hotel; we didn't try it because we didn't know if they would be ready for our two active boys! We did enjoy the hotel pool, the breakfast buffet, and the proximity to the Eaton Centre (connected through an indoor walkway!). We are looking forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, decent experience”
Reviews.Author: buddstroud
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I read mixed reviews on this website and wasn't sure what to think. So when my husband and I booked a 2 night trip there in March, we figured we would go in wtih an open mind. The hotel is perfectly located if you want to shop. However, it was a bit off for most of the other "touristy" things - ie. CN Tower, the theatre district, Casa Loma, Greek Town, etc. Most anything else we wanted to do we had to drive to, and with all the construction in the city, this was not always an easy feat. We were welcomed warmly and were given the option to either valet our car or self-park with in/out privileges. We opted to self-park thinking it would save time overall. For the parking: MAKE SURE to inquire about this at the front desk at check in. We figured they would automatically bill us as other Marriotts do for self-park. They do not. If you don't say anything and get a pre-paid ticket you pay each time you go in and out of the garage, and if you are parked longer than 24 hours, you are charged a premium. After learning this the first time we were charged, we asked the hotel to help us figure out how to get back what the "overpay" was and do it correctly moving forward. We were told that it was too late, and it had to be done our first day. So no help there. We had to change rooms within the first 20 minutes we were there. The walls were paper thin and we could hear every conversation (and argument) in the room next to us. We called down to the front desk to request a change and were told they would call us right back. I had to call back 30 minutes later, and they had no record of me calling the first time! After I explained it all again, they finally got us another room at the end of the hallway (ask for an end or corner room - it was twice as large), and had someone bring us our new keys. The breakfast buffet was decent - a bit different than other Marriotts we have stayed at, but overall ok. We had a great rate - $159 CAD, which included our room and breakfast. Other than that, there wasn't much to write home about at this hotel. It needs updating, but I will say that they were installing a new fitness room with very much updated (and needed) equipment in it - looked like it would be ready soon for the public. Honestly, if you are going to Toronto and want to be near shopping, this will be ok for you (but so would the Sheraton). If you want to be near the Lakefront, CN Tower, Yonge St, and the theatre district, the Renaissance would be a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrbjsbrb
Reviews.Content: We were here for 6 nights and the staff were wonderful and friendly. Had a problem the first night with noise next door on the connecting door, not a problem at all, they moved us to another room at once. It was early, around 7:00 ish, so we had not unpacked yet. We got to the hotel at 11:30 and asked for an early check in, not a problem, they were happy to help. The sports bar was fun and friendly, had happy hour food, excellent !!!! Make the 4-6:00 time frame, its worth it. The gift shop was run by a special couple, thank you !!! Make sure you eat at the DUKE OF RICHMOND!!!!!!!!! THE FOOD IS GREAT AND A REAL DEAL FOR TORONTO !!! It's right around the corner from the hotel. We could not of been happier. Thank you Marriott for such fine service. You all get an A* in my book.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monty553
Reviews.Content: I stayed here between 28th Dec and 3rd Jan 2007. The hotel is excellant with very friendly and efficient staff, and it is in a good location for downtown Toronto. Rooms are nice and spacious. Food very good in the hotel's JWs steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Tabiri
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. I stayed there for a conference in September. It's great for people visiting Toronto. I grew up near there so I don't really like it that much. The central location is ideal for travellers, tourists, or people who want to be central. The hotel itself is class all the way. The elegant boardrooms, lobby and cafe. The rooms are pretty much what you'd expect from any hotel, except for the beds. They are heaven! You're surrounded by downy softness. Tons of down filled pillows, with more in the closet and dresser. Down filled duvet and mattress cover. They allowed me to check in 2 hours beforehand, which I appreciated as I was coming in on the train. They emailed me the confirmation ahead of time. There was a little bit of confusion because I booked with a credit card but wanted to pay cash, but they were prompt is sorting it out. Room Service is decently priced (lunch and dinner are anyway, breakfast is overpriced). Service was really great. The price of the hotel is a little steep, but it's because you pay for the convenience of being in downtown Toronto and attached to the Eaton Centre. Overall, excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon inToronto”
Reviews.Author: Dinkerdmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Eaton Centre for part of our honeymoon. We had a great time. The hotel was great. We enjoyed nearly everything about the hotel. The central location was perfect for us as tourists. We were able to walk from the hotel to the Hockey hall of Fame, the Rogers Centre, art museums, theaters, restaurants, shopping. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the sports bar on the first floor was a great place to hang out. There were only 3 minor disappointments -- the concierge lounge was full of families with kids so breakfast was a bit noisy and crowded, the rooftop pool was small and also full of kids, and food at the hotel was pricey -- we got better quality food at more reasonable prices at nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Worth repeating...”
Reviews.Author: sarzee
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! This was our second stay at this property and although it wasn't quite the same as our visit for New Year's Eve it will continue to be our favourite place to stay in Toronto. It is connected by a walkway to the Eaton Centre and when you park at the hotel (valet is the way for only $25) you can get just about anywhere on foot, bus, or subway. We book the Romance Package and it is well worth it. One night stay in a king size room, champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, valet parking, and the most amazing buffet breakfast are all included for $220-$250 depending on the time of year. They have other great packages including one that gives you a $25 gas coupon or gift card for the mall. The staff are incredible and don't accept tips, so if you are not from North America this is the place for you. Great service is offered without the expectation of a gratuity. In-room movies are a horrendous price, but that's not unusual at hotels. The bathroom products are stellar and each room has a coffee maker. If you are looking to do it up right this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service, no soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: SurfaceTravel
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel half-a-dozen times in the past and had been very impressed with it. The service has always been excellent. We often used to go on massive shopping trips and had to transport many large boxes to and from our rooms. The bell staff (usually women) would handle this for us cheerfully. I would often try to tip them, sometimes $20, but they always refused, stating that it was against hotel policy and that it was "part of the service". This happened all the time, and still did on this last trip. The location is also perfect for us: next to the Eaton Centre and walking distance to Chinatown and Queen Street. The rooms are large and the food in the dining room is decent enough. Now maybe our expectations of hotels have risen in recent years, or maybe we were just given a uniquely bad room for the first time, but our room was noisy! It was like there was no sound-proofing whatsoever. We could hear people walking and talking in the hallway and talking in the next room. This really annoys me, enough that I will not stay there again in spite of the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Just a good location”
Reviews.Author: Portland64
Reviews.Content: Myself ,husband and another couple who are good friends where visiting from England and stayed at the Marriott Toronto Downtown Eaton Centre Hotel for one night on the 26th August 2006. We where all visiting family in nearby Onatrio but wanted to enyoy a night out in Toronto,our children stayed with family whilst we looked forward to having some time to pamper ourselfs.This hotel was chosen because it supposedly has a good reputation and it was in a prime location.We paid $540 for two rooms for the night , this was to include the romantic package of sparkling wine and chocolate dipped strawberries and breakfast. WHERE SHALL I BEGIN? ARRIVAL When we arrived at the front of the hotel for valet parking one of the hotel staff approached our vehcile and started speaking strangely to our friend who was driving (he is Afro caribean) our friend baffled ;explained he didn't understand what was being said and the staff member said in a jokey way I am speaking African to you,we where clearly offended and shocked by his presumptious,unprofessional manner ,my friend stated that although he was black he was not African and spoke English.Our experience with the staff didn't get any better from here BOOKING IN & ROOMS The rooms where prebooked but when we arrived we had to hang around the corridor for over half an hour because there had been some mix up with the reservation, it was very embarrassing and a waste of prescious time.Whilst waiting I asked the consierge where the washrooms where and he was very unhelpful and quite rude.When things where eventually sorted out and we where booked into our allocated rooms they where freezing,although there was a thermostate you could only turn on the air con ,we asked for it to be checked and the maintance man basically said there was nothing that could be done, along with that the view from window was awful.After complaining we where moved to other rooms which where just as cold but we decided it was a waste of time saying anything as it was obvious that the main central heating system was turned off until winter also the view was slightly better and we just wanted to make the most of the experience without constantly complaining, What i can say about the room is that they where very clean and the bed was super comfy thats where it ends.We all expected more for what we had paid for as it was very chinzy, basic and formal, nothing special.We decided that obviously we had paid for the location and thats it really.If you like shopping its ideal because its attached to a giant mall in the centre of Toronto.Unfortunatly we didn't have much time to shop or look around as the whole booking in/changing rooms scenario took most of our valubale time up. Around the hotel is very grand and glamourous but it was spoiled by numerous cigerate dimps and empty drink cans thrown on corridors and out side the lift (they where until the next day when we booked out) The nightlife in Toronto was great and we enjoyed it immensly,the following morning we had breakfast in bed which was not that great so quite a bit was wasted. THE ICE LADY Before booking out at 12 noon we wanted to enjoy a relaxing time in the health spa/sauna which opened at 6am.We went down at 10am and the woman on reception was so unproffessional its unbelieveable,she was busy small talking on the phone with a friend and had no intention of finishing her conversation, she gave us no instructions on what to do and basically ignored us.After standing around looking puzzeled we decided to enter the changing rooms,my friend went back out to ask for towels and was met by an icy glare she might of well as put up a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the desk ,there was no acknowlegment of any kind other than the body language of distane.We got ready to go into the sauna and it was cold,I went out to ask why it wasn't hot and was told I had to operate it myself when i ask how, i was spoken to like an idiot.As I have already stated we didn't want anything to spoil our time spent there so we refused to cause a scene,i went back in and after a few attempts we managed to get the sauna started, it was obvious it would take some time to heat up so we went to sit in the hot tub to wait- this was out of order and also the pool stairs could not be accessed.Whilst we discussed the disatisfaction of the facilities with other unhappy guests the woman on reception decided to butt in as she had now finished talking on the phone and wanted to get cheeky.When i asked why the sauna was not switched on from 6am as stated she said the hotel needed to save electicity-at that point i told her we had paid enough money to stay in the hotel and also that she had really bad manners and was obviously not suited to the job as she was not interested in the guests. SUMMARY Our run ins with staff ended there and we never bothered complaining it just made us think we would not recommend this hotel to anyone-especially someone looking for a romantic break. The Hotel needs to do some serious retraining on customer service for most of the staff we encountered and also update some of the facilities ie TVs , decor in rooms, Sauna/spa facilities There was one member of staff on reception who was very nice and helpful her name was 'AMA 'and she was happy to help and was the only one who made us feel welcome.THANKS AMA

Reviews.Title: “Marriott - Eaton Center - Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Generalque
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a long weekend. From the moment we arrived until we left, the staff was exceptional - totally flawless! Make sure you see Ralph in JW's Steakhouse if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Great service and location, Wonderful breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20's and stayed at Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre in early June. I have to admit that I am usually very worried about hotels and their cleanliness... but this hotel was extremely clean. The maid service was excellent and very prompt. We experienced no problems in this area -- like we usually do in other hotels. The hotel staff was very friendly and offered great service. This was our first time in Toronto, and they were very helpful in guiding us to certain places that we asked about... restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. This hotel has a great location and allowed us to walk to all places we wanted to go. The breakfast that is served at the hotel is wonderful!! It is a little expensive, but they offer a great variety. Unlike many other hotel breakfasts, this one actually has good food! One restaurant that you must visit - if you are interested in Italian food - is Terroni. The hotel staff may act like they don't know where it is... but it's on Queen St. For some reason, when we asked about it, they acted like they never heard of it - but it was packed, and they have awesome food!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Fan-of-Maui
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott in mid-June for one night on a business trip. It is adjacent to the Eaton Centre mall, and across the street from the Toronto city hall. This makes it an ideal location for vacationers, but a bit far if you have meetings in the main business district in the downtown core (although it's not too bad for that). I hesitate to start with a description of a not-so-good experience, but the staff response to the not-so-good experience was handled so well that in the end, I left the hotel quite impressed. The issue I had is that the phone system in some of the rooms was not functioning when I checked in. The front desk clerk told me about it, and said the hotel would pay for a calling card for me if I wished to make calls. I thought that was OK, so I accepted the room and settled in. I tried to hook up my computer to the internet in the room afterwards, but I found that this was not working either because of the phone line issue. I called the customer service person (with my cell phone!) and said that I really needed to do some work on my computer and I asked whether they could not speed up the repair on the line. The customer service person was quite apologetic and told me that she would see what she could do. A few minutes later this person came to my room and handed me a key to another room that happened to have its line fixed already for that night. I moved, and everything was then OK. I thought that the service response was great - I have never had someone come to my room to hand me another key. The room itself was up to Marriott's usual standards - well done, not over-the-top luxurious, but very nice. The bed was comfortable and I got a good night's sleep. I recommend this hotel, especially if you want to do a bit of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ssful
Reviews.Content: In light of the strength of the Canadian dollar and on shopping for rates we were able to stay here for under 100 dollars a night inculding a made to order breakfast served in a very pleasant restaurant. The hotel is a short walk to Eaton Centre, We also walked to the Hockey Hall of Fame ,and the Skydome..although at night I would take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1stclass
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were in Toronto for a family emergency. The hotel is wonderfully located to all metro hospitals and when some very important down time is needed the Eaton Center mall is attached so you do not have to worry about the weather or putting on a coat. The service was exceptional, the beds VERY comfortable and the room is really nice size. There is a lovely indoor pool and Jacuzzi on the roof as well. I will stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Enjoy Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Adriatica
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with our stay at this hotel from the moment we arrived there. The staff was kind and attentive, the location was excellent, and the room was clean and well laid out. As many reviewers have already pointed out, this is an excellent location for shopaholics. The hotel is conected to Eaton's centre through Sears. Very close is also the shopping district on Queen street. The hotel is also close to the Bus Terminal and Entertainment district. Two blocks from the hotel, on Elm stret, there's a strip of nice, reasonably priced restaurants. The only thing I was surprised about was the fact that they charge you to access Internet from their business centre. Why? Not that I needed it so badly, but it would have been nice to have this convenience without having to bring your own laptop or pay for something so basic. All in all, this is a wonderful place to stay and enjoy Toronto. I would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 2 separate trips to Toronto in the last 14 months and really enjoyed each stay. Clean modern rooms, reasonably good service, excellent concierge, good restaurant. On each occasion I paid about $175 Canadian/night for the room (wouldn't pay a lot more for it).If shopping is not a top priority, there are probably more convenient locations for tourists to stay, but if you want to do some serious shopping, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rudolph2
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Marriott. Covenient location. Clean, confortable, updated rooms. Staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. We could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “very average and overpiced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't agree with the majority of the rave reviews for this hotel. It's best asset is the central Toronto location and beautiful public areas. However, the rooms are very average (no safe, mini-bar for example). During my stay, the first room I was given had a locked adjoining door. The room next to mine was obviously a large suite occupied by several people. Because of the adjoining door and no soundproofing between these rooms, I could hear their group conversations as if they were sitting next to me. Finally I called at midnight to insist on another room which they gave me. However, the next day after walking around in this room for an hour in clean white socks...I noticed that the bottom of these socks were filthy with dirt, grime. Obviously this hotel very rarely shampoos the carpets. My basic perception was that the rooms had a dated, unclean vibe. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay here regulary for business, and enjoy my stays very much. I book in advance so I don't get stuck at other hotels. The hospitality is great, and the staff remembers who I am when I go back. It's also quite cozy so it's almost like you're at home. My only advice is to ask for a room opposite the construction side...

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_HW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights. The hotel is in a great location and staff were efficient and polite. However, we were very dissapointed when we checked in to find that our sheets had stains on them and looked worn. The sheets looked as though they had not been changed when we checked in. We called reception at 3am to get them changed, they were apologetic and changed them immediately but even the 'new' sheets still had holes and looked worn! Dissapointed since this is suppose to be a 5 star establishment. Think it's in real need of refurbishment. Not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at Marriott in March with a four year old and a teenager. We were upgraded to a nicer room simply when asking if our room would be big enough for all of us. That was great. They told us they would just send up extra cots for the kids. Few hours went by, and still no cots, and the four year old was getting tired. Called down twice, still no cots, finally my husband had to go down to complain at desk, finally 20 minutes later got both of the cots. The breakfast on room service and in the hotel (buffet and menu) are both pretty pricey (around 18$ each approx). There is a small area outside the restaurant that you can purchase coffee/muffins etc. which services starbucks coffee (for us Tim Horton's drinkers...not so great!!). Nice plush chairs to relax and drink, and you can sign the drinks up to your room. You can also sit there at night and have an pricey martini or other drink. There is a roadhouse type bar on one side of hotel, went there for pitcher one night, seems alright. We didn't eat at the steak bar though. The pool didn't have a shallow end for small children, so if you have a younger child you have to hold them the whole time. Hot Tub was good. Work out room is past the pool, seems to have quite a few good machines, small room though. Pool glass enclosed walls to see city from high up floor (top?). Expensive parking. ($something like $20 a day or something, so 3 days is pretty pricey).

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but watch out for bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location and good service. Staff here is quite friendly and willing to help out. However, we were dismayed to find out that there were remnants of urine stains in the toilet seat. We had our 4 year old son in the room and he is toilet trained, but I guess he can't help but 'miss' sometimes. When we got back to the hotel from our day long outing, the room was nice and clean except for the bathroom. The rooms are OK but somewhat outdated. They didn't have a safe (important for passports) or refigerator (we requested one and they set it up in our room). We always choose Marriott whenever we take trips around the world (e.g. Paris), but this is one Marriott hotel I don't think I will come back to.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cyberdad
Reviews.Content: A good example of a big city Marriott that has its act together. Exceptionally well-run and well-maintained facility. Clean comfortable rooms, attractive public areas, excellent restaurant, and a friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable staff. A tad on the pricey side, but then again this is a major hotel in a major city. The prices here certainly aren't out of line when compared with comparable hotels in comparable cities. Especially given the prime location adjacent to Eaton Centre and within walking distance (or easy subway or taxi commute) to most of the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJay
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel and found it to be quite excellent. The location is perfect in the heart of Toronto, right next door to the Eaton Center shopping mall. Because the hotel backs onto a small courtyard, you could not hear any street noise. (see photo) The breakfast buffet was a little expensive but the food and service were both very good. Parking is also expensive at $18 per day and the garage was small. It looked like we were lucky to get a parking spot. The lobby is very appealing and the front desk staff were professional and polite. There was also someone roaming around the lobby to help guests with any questions. Big baskets of apples to welcome you at the front desk when checking in! The rooms were Marriott quality with all the requisite amenities you would expect. No disappointments, location is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Eaton Centre has to be one of the most overpriced hotels in the city. Everything about the hotel is fine, and therein lies the discrepency. I've stayed at many hotels in Toronto, and for less than $250, and received a better product and much better service than here. The closeness to the Eaton Centre is nice, but the gigantic construction zone around the hotel isn't. I've stayed at the Hilton, Sheraton and Cambridge Suites for far less $$ and had a much better experience. Avoid this hotel, it's just a cash cow for Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, with our 2 young children, at the start of April 2005. We have prevoiusly stayed at 3 or 4 other hotels in Toronto over the last year at around the same price. We were very impressed with the hotel in general. We had breakfast and lunch at the Parkside restaurant in the hotel, the food was of a very high standard, and children less than three eat free ( it costs $7.95 for children over three for the breakfast buffet). The staff in the restaurant were both friendly and efficient. Our room was large, well furnished and clean. It was a non smoking room - at all other hotels in which we have stayed in Toronto have also given us non smoking rooms but all have smelt of smoke, this was not the case with the Marriott. The pool was quite small, but suitable for the children to use. The front desk staff were also friendly and helpful with any requests. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Toronto (we have high expectations from hotels, which can sometimes cause disappointment -not so this time!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto alot and always use this hotel. It is convenient to my office, but I am always impressed the friendly and professional staff, nice rooms and good food. The restaurant always has plenty of fresh fruit and a great selection for breakfast. The room service is always on time and tastey...I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bugs.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised, after reading the reviews on this site, and visiting the hotel the disparity that exists between the two. I must admit, the location is perfect! Right downtown, close to everything! I did however find the staff to be very indifferent, almost cold and the rooms to be on the smaller side. The worst part of the stay however was finding two LARGE insects or animals, something in the room! One was dead and under the chair in the room, and the other my husband saw scurrying across the floor. When we complained to the front desk, they didn't say sorry, they simply said they'd send someone up. Maybe this is common? Well, after 45 minutes, no one showed up so I called the desk again. They said "he" was called and must be busy. We waited another 20 minutes before anyone came. The gentleman was excessively rude, simply entered the room, removed the dead bug and looked VERY quickly over the rest of the room before saying "Looks like we got em all". I was so frustrated. At check-out we mentioned it again, but nothing was done. This time the clerk did manage a sorry, but it was forced. Stay here if you can put up with bugs and indifferent staff. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great staff, friendly people, and amazing location for shopaholics! Rooms are clean, concierge is great, overall an excellent stay! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just has my 2nd visit to this hotel in two years. Brilliant location if you like shopping! The Eaton Centre is marvellous.. The staff at the hotel were polite and helpful at all times. And David and Paul the Concierges were very knowledgable and nothing was too much trouble.. The Parkside breakfast was the best buffet breakfast I have ever had. Can't wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay, nothing special. I think I must have missed what most people rave about. The room was a standard hotel room, nothing special or unique. The staff were welcoming, but not overly friendly. The rate was a little high, but the location is quite good. All in all, I'd say this hotel is ok. Price needs to go down a bit and staff friendliness up some.
